Problem: Chimney seems to be able to collapse at any moment. You can see daylight through mortar joints.
Solution: Demo the damaged portions of the chimney and repair with new brick and mortar as needed.

Problem: Tub grab bar is loose and dry wall around tub is water damaged.
Solution: Remove grab bar and remove soft/damaged drywall. Install new dry wall as needed and install a new grab bar.

Problem: Floor rotten in the bathroom that has caused a hole in the floor in between the sink and tub. Flooring around the toilet is soft and is causing the toilet to rock.
Solution: Tear out old floor and fixtures. (sink, tub, toilet). Repair any joists and lay new subfloor.

Problem: Only two beds for 6 children. Current beds are worn out.
Solution: Take out the old beds and replace with 6 new mattresses.

Problem: Only 1-2 burner work on the stove.
Solution: Remove old damaged stove and reinstall a new stove with correct plugin.

Problem: Front deck has no hand rail.
Solution: Install new handrail using 4x4 posts and 2x4 rails at 36" high.

Problem: Back deck is rotting and is unsafe.
Solution: Replace with similar sized deck (10' x 10') with standard 36" high railings and low rise steps.

Problem: Roof is leaking in a few places.
Solution: Remove and repair damaged plywood/shingles as needed. Install new purlins and metal roofing.

Problem: Front door needs to be replaced.
Solution: Install new front door with operating latch. Install new storm door.

Problem: Roof is leaking at seams.
Solution: Framing and purlins, metal roof needed. Build new roof over old roof.

Problem: Rat and roach infestation.
Solution: Hire an exterminator to address the infestation.

Problem: Water heater not plumbed to code. Only copper fittings are to be fitted directly to the tank
Solution: Have a licensed plumber or qualified handyman replace pex connections with copper fittings.

Problem: Air is able to get through seams of the front door.
Solution: Add weather stripping to help seal the door.

Problem: Multiple windows are broken and not functioning and some are boarded up.
Solution: Remove all broken and boarded up windows and replace with new windows

Problem: Front door stoop is a tripping hazard.
Solution: Demo and replace with new stoop

Problem: Exterior lap siding is broken and/or missing in multiple places.
Solution: Remove and replace as needed.

Problem: Interior walls have paneling and tar paper and are covering old bead board walls which traps moisture.
Solution: Remove paneling and tar paper to inspect for water damage on the walls. Demo damaged walls as needed and repair

Problem: Ceiling is sagging and rotten in various places throughout the house due to the roof leaks. Mold also seems to be an issue in these spots.
Solution: Demo all old bead board ceiling. Replace with new ceiling material.

Problem: Unconventional railroad tie foundation wall for house addition seems to be in a state of collapse.
Solution: Due to the unconventional nature of the foundation, a certified structural engineer would be needed to inspect and make recommendations on solutions.

Problem: Front porch has many rotten boards and is missing a hand rail on the right end.
Solution: Demo rotten boards and replace where applicable. Build new hand rail at the right end.

Problem: Floor sagging in various places in the house and some floors are soft in various places of the house. Most notably the left side of the living room and kitchen. Also in the bathroom/laundry room. Sagging under the washer as well as the toilet. A piece of plywood was being used to cover the sagging floor at the washer. The toilet is also loose.
Solution: Scope of work is so large that a more thorough inspection of the flooring system is needed in basement/crawlspace because of possible foundational issues. If foundational issues are found, they would need to be addressed first. To begin any work on the flooring system, the home would need clutter and things moved out. Then demo and replacement of the joists and subfloor could start.

Problem: Roof has several long term leaks throughout the house that could be contributing to severe structural damage of the roofing framing system and support walls. Porch roofing and framing does not properly tie into the framing of the existing structure.
Solution: Replace old roofing and repair rafters and sheathing as needed.

Problem: Bedroom window sills are rotting.
Solution: Uncover four exterior panels to the left and right of two windows to inspect total damage. Remove old windows and repair framing, sheathing, and insulation as needed. Install new windows and reinstall metal siding panels.

Problem: Floor rotting in the bathroom under the tub. Causing one existing hole
Solution: Inspect underneath from the crawlspace to determine the extent of damage if possible. Based on findings, remove tub and tile flooring as needed. Replace any subfloor that has rotted and repair and floor joists as needed. Install new tub and new flooring.

Problem: Front door ramp is very steep
Solution: Demo old ramp and replace with ADA compliant ramp

Problem: Water quality concerns.
Solution: Contact home inspection service to check water

Problem: Septic tank backing up / failing
Solution: Contact Septic Service provider to get recommendation.

Problem: Cut off valves underneath bathroom sink leak when turned on.

Flickering lights. Ceiling fan not working but light kit does. Power only present on one leg of some double pole breakers.
Solution: Have a qualified licensed electrician assess the situation and provide possible solutions.

Solution: Demo and replace hand rail.

Problem: Well pump needs replaced.
Solution: There was air in the lines but it seems to have fixed itself. If problems comes back, recommend well pump and check valve replacement.

Problem: Stain Porch and steps
Solution: Stain Porch and steps

Problem: Needs porch/stairs stained
Solution: porch/stairs stain

Problem: Needs low rise stairs stained
Solution: Stain low rise stairs

Problem: **?Needs porch and/or steps stained**
Solution: **Porch and/or steps stained**

Problem: Needs porch and/or steps stained
Solution: Porch and/or steps need to be stained

Problem: Needs porch/stairs to be painted/stained
Solution: Stain or paint porch/ stairs

Problem: Ramp and Low rise stairs need paint or stain
Solution: Paint or Stain ramp and low rise stairs

Problem: #13 Signage needed at bottom of driveway, mailbox is missing.
Solution: Install a sign or mailbox to show #13 is there.

Problem: Underpinning is dry rotting and broken by weed eater, also there is a lot of erosion that has moved the underpinning out of position.
Solution: Demo underpinning and install a foam fake rock option.

Problem: Gutters need to be cleaned/replaced.
Solution: Clean gutters or possibly install new ones if needed.

Problem: Grab bars needed in master bath, and any where else Tom may need them.
Solution: Take 3-4 grab bars and install in bath room/where needed.

Problem: Boot for wood stove pipe is leaking.
Solution: Install a new boot around the wood stove pipe.

Problem: The master bathroom needs plumbing repair
Solution: Repair broken supply lines and any other lines that may have froze and busted.

Problem: Front deck is poorly built, very water damaged, and has too high of step up for the client.
Solution: Demo deck, rebuild at door thresh hold height so there is no more step up, build low rise steps with handrail.

Problem: Pipes froze and bust at well house, and under sinks inside main house, and possibly under the trailer as well.
Solution: Send a plumber or Mathew Ponder to assess system and begin repairs. Tom has a brand new pressure tank in the box.

Problem: The furnace is not working.
Solution: Send repairman to fix or replace furnace.

Problem: Tile in kitchen has become a trip hazard for both clients in the home.
Solution: Replace with new vinyl flooring and low thresholds

Problem: Bathroom has had a long leak underneath cabinet rotting floor and subloor
Solution: Replace subfloor and install new vinyl flooring and 36" vanity with moen faucet

Problem: Dryer for laundry currently vented underneath home causing additional moisture.
Solution:
Install new 4” rigid or flexible rigid ducting from new bath vent fans at ceiling to terminate at the exterior to the left (from the inside) of the window.

  * All connections shall be sealed with foil tape
  * Exterior termination shall have a rodent proof vent cap

Problem: Chimney looks as if water could begin coming into home.
Solution: **Re-seal existing flashing to stone chimney to ensure water tightness**

Problem: Gutters are undersized and clogged in places.
Solution: **Remove and dispose of gutters along back of home. Install approx. 55’ of new 6” seamless gutters and attach to existing downspouts.**

Problem: There are 12 single pane windows in the home that either won't open, stay open or lock.
Solution: **Replacement windows shall be double-hung, Energy Star qualified vinyl windows with grids and screens. Windows shall be Jeld-Wen V-2500 or Pella 150 series quality**

Problem: Den has an unvented propane heater which is not safe.
Solution: **Replace existing propane room heater with direct vent room heater**

Problem: Ramp has a handrail that needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace small handrail on ramp.

Problem: Soffit, corners, and fascia board all need paint.
Solution: Prepare for paint, and paint white.

Problem: Roof has many missing shingles from wind damage and they are almost 20 years old.
Solution: Tear off shingles, replace underlayment if needed. Reinstall shingles.

Problem: Bathroom missing shower stall.
Solution: Install new shower stall.

Problem: Front door has lots of damage.
Solution: Replace front door.

Problem: Lots of trash around house.
Solution: Bag up and haul to dump.

Problem: House has lots of trash and debris inside.
Solution: Bag up and haul to dump.

Problem: Miscellaneous Siding and soffit missing.
Solution: Reinstall missing pieces.

Problem: Kitchen and bathroom faucet are leaking under cabinets.
Solution: Replace faucets and/or plumbing underneath faucets.

Problem: Front and Back steps and landings have not been stained.
Solution: Paint or stain to extend the life of steps

Problem: Underpinning is missing around the majority of the back side of the home and some is missing in the front.
Solution: Install new underpinning to help with insulation and prevent critters from getting under and in the home.

Problem: Water is running down the house due to clogged gutters.
Solution: Replace clogged gutters and downspouts.

Problem: Siding missing on the back of house.
Solution: Install siding (some is there on site) to keep wall from receiving anymore water damage.

Problem: 4-5 broken windows and one is just missing entirely.
Solution: Replace windows.

Problem: Soft Flooring in kitchen
Oil tank leaking
Solution: Tighten up fittings

Problem: The back steps need a handrail, otherwise she did not want to change anything but just add a handrail.
Solution: Add a handrail to back steps that is approx 36" high off the nosing of existing concrete steps.

Problem: New Low rise steps needed at front. Existing steps are almost rotten.
Solution: Demo existing steps and build low rise steps with 2x4 handrail on both sides and a max rise of 5.5"

Problem: Bedroom door not shutting.
Solution: Tweak door hinge/hardware to achieve proper function.

Problem: Back deck is in bad shape.
Solution: Renter states they do not use the back deck or steps and he seems resistant to change/help but in case of a fire I recommend rebuilding with 4x5 landing and steps so that he has an escape out the back.

Problem: The front porch is made from 2x6 floor joists and 2x4 rafters, it is sinking into sandy soil.
Solution:
Jack up porch and install some block or concrete under the sinking posts.

Rebuilding this porch at a smaller size would be the best option but the renter does not want that.

Problem: There is a very uneven threshold going into spare bathroom.
Solution: add some 1/2" plywood under the carpet and make a thresh hold that is not a tripping hazard.

Problem: Needs two grab bars in main bathroom.
Solution: Use 1/2" tile bit and toggle anchors to install grab bars.

Problem: Needs low rise steps at front porch.
Solution: Demo old steps, build new steps 4' wide, with handrail on both sides. 12" tread width and max of 5.5" of riser.

Problem: Old barn tin roof is not actually leaking anywhere except around wood stove boot but the recent wind storms have loosened some peices.
Solution: Use marine screws to re-attach any loose barn tin.

Problem: Steps from the porch to the side yard need to be replaced and have no handrail.
Solution: Demo old steps, build low rise steps here (5.5" rise) with handrail.

Problem: Leak around the wood stove smoke stack. Water is running down causing rust.
Solution: Redo boot on roof.

Problem: Bathroom near kitchen needs a more accessible shower stall with grab bars.
Solution: If we can't do the other bathroom, we should look at making this one more accessible with a shower stall and some grab bars.

Problem: George gutted a bathroom to remodel it and needs help finishing it. He did this to make a handicap accessible bathroom for his 96 year old mom.
Solution: The bathroom needs to be completely rebuilt. Install flooring, plumbing, fixtures, tile, and trim. There is also a window to install.

Problem: Line filter on oil tank is leaking.
Solution: Tighten lines but do not over tighten or break line. If there is still a leak, filter may need to be replaced.

Problem: Front porch low rise steps needed.
Solution: There are concrete steps here, build additional set of low rise steps off to the side.

Problem: Hole in kitchen wall where the wood stove stack used to be.
Solution: Repair wall and paint.

Problem: Siding incomplete
Solution: Finish vinyl siding.

Problem: Soffit and fascia incomplete.
Solution: Finish soffit and fascia, replace sub fascia if needed.

Problem: Broken window in spare bedroom.
Solution: Replace window.

Problem: Soft flooring in living room under the couch.
Solution: Recommend full floor repair, replace framing as needed, replace plywood with Advantech, install finish flooring LVP/linoleum.

Problem: Bathroom accessibility mods needed.
Solution: This might be a could one to try the clean-cut bath mod. Install clean cut bath tub cut out and some grab bars in the bath room.

Problem: Front door needs to be replaced.
Solution: Remove old door, install 32x80 RH inswing door, insulate around gap, trim, caulk.

Problem: Bathroom floor has basketball sized hole in the middle and the entire floor feels rotten.
Solution: There must be some major termite or water damage here, replace subfloor framing, plywood (use Advantech) and LVP. This repair should include floor under the water heater as well. Bathroom fixtures to be replaced as needed. Replace water heater if needed. Install PAN under water heater.

Problem: Living room floor had carpet pulled up but never installed finish flooring.
Solution: Cover with vapor barrier and finish flooring. Flooring options based on funding source. It could be linoleum, LVP, or prefinished flooring.

Problem: Back deck is rotten.
Solution: Demo deck, rebuild small deck with steps approx 5x5'

Problem: Front porch roof is too flat and the deck needs to be rebuilt.
Solution: Demo roof and deck, rebuild deck, steps, and handrail. The roof is all shingles, I do not want to rebuild another flat roof here with shingles. If we rebuild porch roof here it needs to be a metal or membrane roof.

Problem: Bathroom accessibility modification needed. There is a 54" bath unit existing. Candy has in storage a 48" shower unit.
Solution: Take out existing tub, install 48" shower and add some grab bars.

Problem: Only 1 working bathroom in a household of 5.
Solution: Full bathroom remodel x2 needed here.

Problem: Roof is covered with debris but is not leaking.
Solution: Sweep off leaves and twigs with a broom.

Problem: Gutters are full of debris and small vegetation growing from gutters on back of house.
Solution: Clean out gutters.

Problem: Outlet on front porch not working.
Solution: Replace GFI with normal outlet.

Problem: Shower stall in master bathroom has a sliding door and a small threshold to step over. You can trip and hit your head at the same time.
Solution: Possible IL referral for walk-in unit. I could install some grab bars in the mean time if needed.

Problem: Gerald has 3 doors with unsafe steps leading to each door. The steps were re-used from when is old house burnt down.
Solution: Demo old steps, build new landing/steps/handrail at each door. Min. 4x4 landing with steps/handrails. Gerald has a bad knee so low rise steps are needed with 6" rise or less.

Problem: Roof is leaking in a few spots, shingles look old. Water damage on ceiling in living room above entertainment center.
Solution: Take off old shingles, repair plywood/framing as needed, install underlayment, install new vent boot and shingles.

Problem: Window has broken glass from a gunshot.
Solution: Replace the window if possible.

Problem: Water damage in wall where window unit AC is in the kitchen.
Solution: Window AC no longer works but they are going to buy a new one. I told them to install it in a way that doesn't let water in to the house. We will address the water damage in the future if it becomes an issues, at this time the floor feels solid in that area.

Problem: Front bathroom has a leaky wax ring on the toilet.
Solution: Replace toilet and wax ring and supply line.

Problem: The master bath needs to be redone.
Solution: The water lines should be fine but the fixtures are not. Bathroom needs to be totally redone and made accessible.

Problem: Front Deck needs to be redone.
Solution: Demo front deck and rebuild 5x10 landing with handrail and steps.

Problem: Back deck needs to be redone.
Solution: Demo small deck and rebuild 5x8 landing, with handrail and steps in the back of house.

Problem: The walkway has some rotting plywood on the roof and at the driveway end, feels like its starting to rot on the flooring.
Solution: Repair walkway with some plywood and light framing on floor.

Problem: Skirting is made with vented soffit. Pipes froze around Christmas during the cold snap.
Solution: Replace this skirting with a foam faux rock options for better protection against the cold.

Problem: Toilet is leaking at the wax seal.
Solution: Remove toilet (replace if needed) repair sub floor plywood if needed. Replace wax seal and reinstall toilet with new supply line.

Problem: Bathrooms need outlets replaced. Living needs ceiling fan replaced.
Solution: Can probably source a ceiling fan from Reclaim, send Electrician to replace outlets and fan.

Problem: Original carpet still in trailer @30 years old with pets, needs to be replaced.
Solution: Remove carpet and padding, clean any mold, install vapor barrier and healthier option for flooring.

Problem: Windows are drafty and have been covered with some foam insulation.
Solution: Replace and insulate windows if possible to get funding

Problem: The back deck is missing the roof/or gutter.
Solution: If possible to get funding, build small porch roof or add a section of gutter here.

Problem: Roof has been Kool Sealed 3 years ago and is not currently leaking but the wind sounded like it was going to rip the roof off the trailer.
Solution: Install tub rib metal roof.

Problem: There is a small ramp in the front of house that is too steep.
Solution: Shawn is not in a wheelchair and does not need the ramp. Replace with steps.

Problem: Back deck needs replaced.
Solution: Demo old deck and build deck with steps and handrails.

Problem: Back door needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace 34x75 7/8 RH outswing mobile home door with new gasket and screws.

Problem: The main furnace does not work, Shawn is using electric heaters for heat, there is an LP heater but it has a small tank and will only last a few weeks during cold spells. No primary source of heat.
Solution: Explore servicing or replacing the existing furnace. Duct work should be in tact.

Problem: Looks like a tree fell on the trailer, damage caused ceiling inside to break and it has mold.
Solution: Repair ceiling inside by removing moldy drywall and installing new. Trailer frame seems crushed a little here, may have to bang it back out.

Problem: Most of the floor is exposed plywood. Lots of torn/worn out linoleum.
Solution: Repair sub floor as needed, install finish flooring.

Problem: Heating bill is approx. 300/month in the winter. Trailer is very drafty around windows. They keep plastic over some windows year round.
Solution: Replace windows if possible.

Problem: Sliding glass door is not functioning well, it can be opened but it is difficult.
Solution: I am not sure if the track is just corroded or if the trailer is settled enough to cause the door to malfunction. Either way it would need to be replaced/reinstalled.

Problem: Kitchen cabinets are falling apart.
Solution: Replace cabinets or repair existing ones with plywood bottoms.

Problem: Home does not have an accessible bathroom.
Solution: Turn front bathroom back into full bath. This will be a full bathroom remodel.

Problem: Sub floor plywood is very weak in the kitchen around the fridge. The fridge is leaning.
Solution: Move fridge out and repair kitchen sub floor underneath.

Problem: Kitchen, and both bathroom traps are leaking.
Solution: Replace traps and make sure they are not leaking.

Problem: Bathroom toilet supply line is leaking when in the on position.
Solution: Shawn has to keep turning it off to stop leak, replace supply line cutoff.

Problem: Front door is beyond repair.
Solution: Replace with 31x74 5/8" RH inswing mobile home door with single diamond window, install new gasket and screws.

Problem: Etta has only a Kerosene heater for heat, her wood heat is not in use due to chimney needing to be cleaned.
Solution: This is a drafty older home, I don't think a mini split would be efficient or warm here. Recommend exploring vented LP gas setup to heat home.

Problem: Etta's car is broke down at the bottom of the driveway.
Solution: Replace serpentine belt, possibly rear main seal is leaking as well.

Problem: Driveway is very rough, full of ruts and potholes.
Solution: Cut down road with blade and add fresh gravel, improving drainage along the way.

Problem: Only one plug in the living room.
Solution: Send electrician to install 1-2 more outlets in living room.

Problem: Lots of cracks in the linoleum due to plywood seams not having any framing under them. Lots of movement at seams ripping linoleum in half over time.
Solution: After fixing the bigger issues with floor, install new linoleum.

Problem: Bath tub kit is separating due to house settling.
Solution: Bath tub kit should be replaced with new one after house is shored up.

Problem: Porch steps have fallen down.
Solution: Rebuild "front" porch steps.

Problem: Floors are extremely unlevel in kitchen and hallway outside kitchen. Front door is swinging in and hitting the floor about half way open.
Solution: The house is settling and no crawl space. The framing is probably locust logs and rough cut lumber. Fixing this floor would require moving furniture and appliances out, demo plywood, level up framing, possibly jacking up exterior walls and shoring them up.

Problem: Mold downstairs at freezer, and a few ceiling tiles, near breaker box.
Solution: Not sure what caused this mold, must have been a water leak at some point. Replace a few ceiling tiles and inspect for leaks.

Problem: Front door needs a little love.
Solution: Shim a hinge and adjust strike plate if need be.

Problem: Lottie has no primary source of heat.
Solution: Recommend heat pump, duct work, full HVAC installation needed.

Problem: Lottie cannot open her windows, they function, but are very tight and were very stubborn to get open.
Solution: The windows could probably be cleaned and lubricated, they are in decent shape. The main problem is there just isn't much of a ledge to grab onto to operate the window. Kitchen window was impossible to open, recommend replacing it.

Problem: Staircase going down in to back yard has very wobbly handrails, Lots of sun damage. Only has two stringers, landing at the top has decking boards detaching.
Solution: Demo and rebuild, use existing stringers as a pattern for new. Have 3 stringers instead of 2. Install blocking between stringers at post locations, to support a more sturdy handrail.

Problem: Rock steps are breaking up (near storage building)
Solution: Steps need to be re-done, could use stone from retaining wall that is falling down to rebuild the steps.

Problem: Rock retaining wall is falling down near storage building.
Solution: Stones could be re-used to rebuild wall, or it could be demolished and left down.

Problem: There are 2 broken windows, 1 at driveway, 1 left of front door.
Solution: Replace sash or window.

Problem: Outside outlet and front porch switch not working.
Solution: Get an electrician out there to replace switch and outlet, and decide what other problems may exist.

Problem: Kitchen sink trap leaking and wrapped with duct tape.
Solution: Replace kitchen sink trap.

Problem: Need threshold in kitchen and shoe mold in living room.
Solution: Install threshold in kitchen and approx 40 linear feet of shoe mold in living room.

Problem: There are several broken spots on the vinyl siding.
Solution: Siding looks very old and brittle, I would recommend covering holes with some Peel and Seal or Vicor tape and paint to match siding. Trying to repair old brittle vinyl siding may lead to more breaks and the siding is probably discontinued.

Problem: Mold behind water heater.
Solution: Confirm water is not leaking, repair if it is. Clean mold with vinegar or bleach then paint.

Problem: Back deck is green with mildew and has no handrail.
Solution: Replace deck, steps, and add code compliant handrail.

Problem: Front deck has a post that is crooked and looks like its falling over. Entire deck needs to be replaced due to sun damage and lack of maintenance.
Solution: Repair post on far side of deck to make sure it is safe and does not fall.

Problem: Ceiling in bathroom is full of black mold from water damage.
Solution: Demo entire ceiling and replace drywall, finish, paint.

Problem: Roof is leaking near the bathroom, cause black mold on the ceiling.
Solution: Identify roof leak (I believe it is the vent boot near bathroom) and repair to stop leak. The metal roof should still be in good condition.

Problem: Roof sustained wind damage recently.
Solution: Tin was folded backwards and will need to be replaced.

Problem: Helen is not able to get into the shower safely. She has been referred to IL for a bathroom modification but in the meantime desperately needs grab bars to prevent a fall.
Solution: Install one grab next to commode, one on wall next to the shower and one inside the shower.

Problem: Window facing driveway near ramp has a hole in the glass from a rock slung by the lawnmower.
Solution: Replace sash, or window.

Problem: Sliding glass door in water damaged wall is not working anymore.
Solution: This wall is in bad shape and the door needs to be replaced or repaired, after the wall is fixed.

Problem: Floors throughout home are very unlevel. There are soft spots in the kitchen but overall it feels very safe, just uneven and unlevel.
Solution: Cannot access under house, floors would have to be repaired from inside.

Problem: Loose siding in a few places.
Solution: Fix loose vinyl siding.

Problem: Back deck is built mostly on the ground and has become rotten.
Solution: Demo deck and replace with 5x4 landing and steps.

Problem: Stone work on front of the house is pulling away.
Solution: Demo stone work, repair framing as needed. Close in Crawl space as needed.

Problem: Bathroom wall and window have major water damage. This is the same load bearing wall as the other wall repair.
Solution: Repair framing as needed, omit window, install new Shower stall if needed.

Problem: Wall where electrical service is, has major water damage. This is a load bearing wall with electrical, AC, and a sliding glass door.
Solution: Repairing this wall will be a major task, Needs drywall removed and inspect the framing, repair as needed. Redo drywall inside. Repairing the exterior sheathing is not recommended, there is most likely asbestos buried under the vinyl siding. Also, the breaker box is in this wall.

Problem: Kitchen cabinets, sink, and countertops are vandalized and beyond repair.
Solution: Replace kitchen base cabinets, install new sink, and countertop.

Problem: Toilets, sinks, and cabinets have all been vandalized in both bathrooms.
Solution: Replaces Toilets, Cabinets, and Sinks in bathrooms. Large jaccuzi tub in master bath may be excluded from this repair.

Problem: Foundation vent falling out.
Solution: Reinstall with mortar in a tube.

Problem: All carpet is very nasty from vandalization.
Solution: Remove all carpet and install finish flooring/baseboard.

Problem: Back deck and steps are rotten and falling apart.
Solution: Demo deck and steps, build 5x4 deck with steps and handrail.

Problem: Many shingles are broken and blown away.
Solution: New metal roof would be ideal, install purlins and metal roof.

Problem: Front porch needs to be completely rebuilt, framing and plywood are rotten.
Solution: Rebuild front porch roof.

Problem: Window in master bedroom will not close and lock
Solution: We were able to get the window partially locked while I was there but it will need to be replaced in the future.

Problem: Broken lines in back bathroom and laundry room.
Solution: Get a plumber to repair any broken lines under trailer.

Problem: Electrical panel (interior breaker box) and several outlets and switches have been vandalized.
Solution: Get an Electrician to rewire breaker box and replace outlets and switches as needed.

Problem: Front and back door both need to be replaced.
Solution: Replace front and back door with Right Hand Inswing 32"x73.5" Trailer door, replace gasket and screws.

Problem: 4 windows in kitchen are old, and have lead paint.
Solution: Replace with 27.5" wide 37.5" tall Pella 150 series replacement window or equal quality replacement window using RRP Lead safe renovation techniques. Insulate gap with foam or pink insulation. Re-install trim or replace if needed.

Problem: Needs a complete well system.
Solution: Install well system.

Problem: Home is incomplete and needs septic installation.
Solution: Have professional contractor install septic system.

Problem: Missing underpinning around back of house and on driveway side.
Solution: Complete underpinning, to prevent entry of critters under the house.

Problem: Need to build steps at back porch.
Solution: Build new steps at back porch with handrail and cap block footing.

Problem: Porch, steps, siding and other misc. areas need paint.
Solution: Paint as needed.

Problem: Water lines have busted several times. Dolores says their was a recall on the lines and they keep breaking at the joints.
Solution: I would like to consult with a plumber about the status of these lines, and if they need to be replaced, get a quote for doing them all.

Problem: Hole in guest bathroom tub. The hole has been patch but still leaks.
Solution: May be possible to patch tub temporarily but eventually it needs to be replaced.

Problem: Kitchen floor will need linoleum once it is repaired.
Solution: Dolores wants to buy the linoleum. Install in kitchen with glue.

Problem: Kitchen floor plywood has water damage from burst sink line. Approx. 12'x13'
Solution: Replace kitchen plywood with Advantech, joists as needed, install linoleum/baseboard.

Problem: Current bathtub is inaccessible and a safety hazard for Patricia.
Solution: Remove bathtub and install an accessible bathtub.

Problem: Bathroom has tub/shower that Clayton has trouble getting in and out of. The bathroom is all original to trailer from 1975 and needs to be redone.
Solution: Remodel bathroom, demo sub floor, repair framing as needed, install Advantech plywood, replace Toilet, Vanity, Sink, and Bathtub with low thresh hold unit.

Problem: Bedroom sub floor needs replaced.
Solution:
Demolish floor, repair any framing as needed, install advantech or high quality floor plywood, install flooring and base board.

Room is 9x13'

Problem: Living room and Kitchen subfloor are both in poor condition. Lots of weak/soft spots and flooring is coming up and a tripping hazard.
Solution: Demolish floor, repair any framing as needed, replace plywood with Advantech or similar quality flooring plywood, install 13' x30' of finish flooring (linoleum or prefinished flooring) install base board.

Problem: IL did a nice ramp here but it has never been painted or stained.
Solution: Clean up ramp, repair any rotten spots (none visible) paint ramp.

Problem: Addition in the back is very unsafe and looks like it is close to falling off support.
Solution: Shore up addition with large beam Clayton has on site. Replace rim and girder joists. Install 4 concrete footers and install 6x6s post in those 4 locations.

Problem: Front and Back door need to be replaced.
Solution: Replace front and back door 3068.

Problem: This trailer has windows and storm windows. Some are broken here and there.
Solution: Replace broken windows with a decent quality replacement window, insulate, trim, and caulk.

Problem: Bedroom door (Morgan) needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace interior door to Morgan's room. I do not have a measurement on this door.

Problem: Driveway of approx 500' needs a lot of work. Full of erosion rutting and large rocks.
Solution: Excavate and repair road bed, install proper drainage, road bond, and gravel.

Problem: Back and front decks need stain or paint.
Solution: Paint or stain front and back deck.

Problem: Back deck steps need to be rebuilt. They are not in terrible shape yet but the last step is only 1" and I consider this a tripping hazard.
Solution: Rebuild steps/handrail. 4 steps exist, rebuild as 5 steps if needed to decrease the rise.

Problem: Fuel smell coming from furnace when its running.
Solution:
Technician who serviced furnace last said that "if this does not work, it has to be the firebox."

Assuming the firebox is cracked and needs to be replaced.

Problem: Back door needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace 32x76 trailer door, gasket, screws, door knob, and deadbolt.

Problem: Large tree growing VERY close to house and starting to disrupt trailer frame and underpinning.
Solution: Need to get a tree guy out there to take down this tree.

Problem: Front porch steps and handrail needs to be rebuilt.
Solution: Rebuild steps and handrail to code. 2x12x10 x3 for stringers.

Problem: Observation deck around back is very rotten and needs to be demolished.
Solution: Demolish deck and do not rebuild.

Problem: Need mailbox installed.
Solution: Install mailbox in driveway turn around.

Problem: Helen needs accessibility modifications to her bathroom tub.
Solution:
This may be a good candidate for a Clean-cutbath cutout.

Otherwise we'd be looking at tub replacement.

Problem: Small landing and steps at Kitchen door are sinking into the ground and rotting.
Solution: Demolish and rebuild small landing with steps.

Problem: Aluminum ramp is being supported by a wooden deck that has rotten deck boards.
Solution: Replace ramp support with a concrete or stone support.

Problem: Back deck is very rotten and unsafe to walk on.
Solution: Demo and rebuild deck. This deck is high in the air and large.

Problem: Bridge going to house is unsafe and needs to be repaired.
Solution: Install steel I-beams to re-enforce bridge going across river leading to house.

Problem: Meter Base and ground rod rusted/water damage.
Solution: Replace meter base and ground rod.

Problem: Ceiling in wood stove room needs to be repaired.
Solution: Repair ceiling with drywall or paneling.

Problem: Front porch plywood is rotting.
Solution: Replace front porch plywood with decking or plywood.

Problem: Appears to be a sinkhole to the right of front door.
Solution: Add fill dirt.

Problem: Subfloor not insulated and basement is not heated.
Solution: Add insulation to subfloor joists.

Problem: The garage door and entry door leading to basement are allowing some water in.
Solution: Install trench drain in front of each door.

Problem: Water is seeping into the basement through the block wall in a few spots.
Solution: I was not able to determine the quantity of water coming in. This could probably be waterproofed from the inside with no digging by a basement waterproofing professional.

Problem: Bathroom floor has dangerous hole in floor near toilet.
Solution: Remove old/soft flooring down to joists. Replace with new framing, sub floor and flooring.

Problem: The site is very littered with trash and junk cars/4 wheelers/tools. I noticed cock roaches while I was there and so did Treva.
Solution: Site need to be cleaned up and pest control can then deal with roach problem.

Problem: Gutters are pulling away from fascia and causing water damage on fascia and soffit.
Solution: Replace or reinstall gutters. They are plastic and will probably break due to being brittle if you take them off so getting new is probably the way to go.

Problem: Living room linoleum is worn and starting to come up.
Solution: Install new linoleum.

Problem: Front bedroom has slight water damage on ceiling drywall, probably due to a leak in the roof.
Solution: I would say it can be repaired but the shingles look much older than 2011. Client was not sure how old house was, first she said 1981, then 2011, I think it may be early 2000's judging by the shingles. Needs new roof.

Problem:
Kitchen floor is very soft from water damage from kitchen sink leaking.

Kitchen sink cabinet is also destroyed from water damage.
Solution:
Demo kitchen floor and kitchen sink cabinet.

Replace with new joists where needed, new plywood, and vinyl click flooring or linoleum.

Problem: Back door has been broken into from outside and is leaking lots of air now, and hard to shut.
Solution: Replace 36" mobile home door in back with new gasket and screws.

Problem: Oil tank appears to be leaking but client says his Dad left the bleed valve open.
Solution: Closed valve, if this solves problem we can click repair done.

Problem: Need grab bar in bathroom low rise shower.
Solution: Install grab bar next to walk-in low rise shower.

Problem: Mold in back storage room where water is getting in.
Solution: If water problem is fixed, clean up mold on ceiling and wall with bleach solution.

Problem: Two outside water spigot have froze and bust during the cold snap. Cut off is not stopping the water completely. Water has burst inside the walls of the home and causing leaking in front room, bathroom and closet.
Solution: Replace cut-off and two water spigot, this is all copper piping and will have to be done from inside, removing paneling to put back later.

Problem: Water shoots over the only gutter in the back causing some flooding in the back storage room then water seeps over to living room.
Solution: Needs a larger gutter in the back and possible offset to catch water better. This may not completely solve problem as the block was sealed with tar before it was backfilled. Tar has broken down and unit is no longer water proofed.

Problem: Beatrice has a difficult time getting into her bathtub due to mobility issues.
Solution: Replace tub with walk-in shower and grab bars.

Problem: Kitchen flooring is completely degraded and customer states he thinks it may be asbestos.
Solution: Demo flooring the rest of the way with respirator and replace flooring with linoleum.

Problem: Moderate amount of trash and debris around jobsite.
Solution: Make a trip to dump to help clean up site.

Problem: Deck boards on front porch are taking a lot of water damage near steps.
Solution: Replace decking boards.

Problem: Gutters are rusting through the bottom and leaking everywhere.
Solution: Replace rusted gutters.

Problem: Tammy has a terrible time getting in and out front door/porch.
Solution: Build 3 steps at door and approx 20' long ramp from front porch.

Problem: Tammy's bathtub is not accessible to her.
Solution: Replace tub with accessible unit.

Problem: Steps leaving Nate's room are bad.
Solution: Add landing and turn steps toward driveway.

Problem: Siding was never painted.
Solution: Paint t-111 siding to prevent further water damage.

Problem: Roof is very rusty, it is not leaking yet.
Solution: Paint or possible replace roof.

Problem: Driveway has eroded and nearly impossible to get up, especially after rain. Parking area has holes which pool with water.
Solution: Excavate for better drainage and add new gravel

Problem: Leak in basement from fitting on pressure tank
Solution: Plumber to replace fitting on pressure tank

Problem: Back door from kitchen is a door to nowhere.
Solution: Build small landing and steps.

Problem: Exposed sub fascia.
Solution: Finish trimming fascia with metal

Problem: Back steps and landing rotten.
Solution: Build new steps and 4x4 landing

Problem: The carpet in the living room is old and bubbles and rolls which is challenging and difficult for Tanner's wheelchair to navigate.
Solution: Replace carpet with smooth vinyl flooring.

Problem: Water pressure is fluctuating
Solution: Send plumber to check system, may need pressure reduction valve?

Problem: Vernon's bathroom needs a low threshold shower.
Solution:
Possible IL referral

Replace bath tub with low threshold shower unit.

Problem: Small deck in the back needs to be replaced
Solution: Rebuild small 4x4 landing with steps

Problem: Very soft flooring around toilet in back bathroom.
Solution: Replace plywood, joists that may be damaged, and toilet wax ring, and toilet if need be.

Problem: Vernon is in a wheelchair and has no ramp.
Solution:
Build landing at kitchen door approx. 4x6'

Build ramp approx. 29' long towards back of red Dodge truck.

Problem: Kitchen door needs to be replace with outswing door.
Solution: Replace door with Left hand outswing 32x80"

Problem: Front door jamb is destroyed from being kicked in.
Solution: Replace 36" x 80" exterior door

Problem: Flooring is torn up in a few places inside. There would be a lot of stuff to move around in order to fix the linoleum.
Solution: Replace linoleum with new, if possible. Small house that is packed with things, could be labor intensive job and Hugh may not want this disturbance.

Problem: Gutters are all in very poor condition.
Solution: Replace gutters. Or discuss option of removing gutters and downspouts entirely.

Problem: Back deck is rotting needs replaced.
Solution: We have aluminum ramp at CHC that should work here.

Problem: All siding has paint peeling off. Matter of time before the house has major water damage in all walls.
Solution:
Need to test for lead paint, if it is negative, we could scrap and paint with a summer group? Or replace siding but that is a risky, may not like what we find under siding.

Paint House Blue

Problem:
Front deck needs replaced 8x6'

30" drop from deck to walkway

Was attached to house with no flashing, there is major water damage on house "rim joist"
Solution: Demo deck, repair damage as needed. Rebuild standalone deck, with low rise steps and wide tread for walker.

Problem: Melted siding from a grill. Double 5 reg lap vinyl siding, gray in color, discontinued siding.
Solution: Replace two pieces of siding at front of house near front door.

Problem: Kitchen sink faucet and drain trap are both leaking.
Solution: Replace faucet and trap, install new sink drain with fresh putty.

Problem: Deck has lots of mildew and needs painting.
Solution: Paint deck to prevent further rotting.

Problem: Loose handrails on the deck at the back of house.
Solution: There is some rotten stringers that posts are attached to. Repair or replace steps, posts, handrail.

Problem: Kitchen floor is rotten and the tile is broken. Floor is very soft and not safe to stand at sink. Etta stands there doing dishes.
Solution: This repair will be hard to do from under house because crawl space is small there, recommend tearing floor up and repairing from top down. Framing, plywood, and flooring need replaced, customer has come vinyl flooring already purchased.

Problem: Toilet is cracked on the inside of bowl. Leak could destroy subfloor and needs to be fixed ASAP.
Solution: Replace toilet with new unit.

Problem: Septic leaking in yard, I could not locate and examine due to large guardian dogs inside fence.
Solution: Customer states there is a leak in the front yard. Locate and repair leak.

Problem: Upper driveway/carport area has major erosion problem.
Solution: Needs a retaining wall and some concrete formed/poured under existing slab.

Problem: Sub Floor needs insulation especially 1st floor and especially master bedroom.
Solution: Insulate with pink batts R-34

Problem: Home only has 1 mini split which is underpowered for the size of home.
Solution: Needs Hvac system with flex duct and heat registers installed.

Problem: Glass is shattered on 58" French Door at basement
Solution: The glass can be replaced, or you could order a door slab, or you could replace the whole door. The door is not in bad condition except for the broken glass (lawnmower caused it) so I would recommend trying to order a replacement door slab as it would be a very quick installation.

Problem: Carpet in living room is very stained and probably moldy underneath.
Solution: Replace with vinyl flooring.

Problem: Front Door is rusty, comes open by itself, and needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace 33x74 5/8" mobile door storm door combo.

Problem: Flooring transitions in kitchen need thresh holds.
Solution: Install some thresh holds on flooring transitions to prevent tripping hazard.

Problem: Michael's bathroom needs a new tub and toilet.
Solution: Replace tub with low rise shower, replace toilet with taller ADA toilet

Problem: Back porch steps are very wacky, there are only two steps with 10-12 inch rise, way too big of a step.
Solution: Replace with low rise steps and handrail

Problem: Front Porch steps built by homeowner are very steep. Looks like premade stringers from Lowes with 8 inch rise.
Solution: Recommend replace with low rise steps to make easier passage.

Problem: There is a fast oil leak from the tank and Judy currently has no heat.
Solution: Judy's son has an oil tank she could use but they have no way of getting it there to be hooked up.

Problem: They asked if the white carpet in the living room could be replaced. I did not specify but maybe thru HOP it could.
Solution: Replace carpet with vinyl flooring if possible.

Problem: There was a subfloor repair in the main bathroom but finish flooring and baseboard was never put down.
Solution: Finish flooring in main bath, small amount of baseboard.

Problem: Front deck is very aged and green
Solution: Demo and rebuild deck.

Problem: 1/2 Bath has very soft subfloor and toilet is moving around, looks close to falling through the floor.
Solution:
They have another bathroom but this is her bathroom and she has not used it for quite some time because of the floor. The toilet may not need to be replaced but the wax ring does and it will have to come up to fix subfloor.

Remove toilet, fix subfloor, reinstall or replace toilet.

Problem: No primary heat source, they are using a kerosene heater. Home had baseboard heat so there is no duct work. She said the baseboard electric heat has not been turned on in approx. 40 years, they are scared to try it as it could be a fire hazard.
Solution: Refer to Community Action. If unable to assist, look at other funding sources.

Problem: Front door is very leaky and damaged from being broken into by a family member once, when everyone got locked out.
Solution: Replace front door with a new unit.

Problem:
A tree fell on the house and damaged the roof, soffit, gutter, and fascia.

Insurance is supposed to be paying for repairs, I guess the thing to do is wait for an update on that and go from there, the house needs a whole new roof, shingles are very aged and has patches already that have leaked over the years. Larry is applying silicon to various roof vents because they leak.
Solution: This could easily be expanded into 4 repairs, I want to see what the insurance pays for and what needs to be repaired after that. I have a feeling they won't fix everything. Repair soffit and fascia, replace gutter, new shingles, vents, boots.

Problem: Very slick paver stones in back yard, I almost fell on them and so did the client.
Solution: They need to be pressure washed, mildew is growing on them making them VERY slick,

Problem: No handrail at steps near pond.
Solution: Install hand rail at steps near pond.

Problem: Master bath needs ADA toilet.
Solution: Install ADA toilet in master bathroom.

Problem: Roof has leaked in several places over the years but they have had a roofer fix it each time.
Solution: The roof is not currently leaking but there is moss growing up there and client states that roofer has told her the shingles were not installed correctly and that is why it keeps leaking. We are not sure the age of current shingles, replace roof if possible.

Problem: Bathroom exhaust fan has been changed out for a smaller one and there is a large gap in the drywall ceiling.
Solution: Patch drywall around exhaust fan.

Problem: Tripping hazard at bedroom entry way flooring transition.
Solution: Add a wooden threshold to help transition be less of a tripping hazard.

Problem: There is mold in the basement foundation wall near the water filtration system.
Solution: There is an area where the outside unit for mini split is, that is built up dirt and moss. They have installed a pool liner to try and stop the water from getting in the basement. This area has incorrect grade, needs to be dug out more so water can move away from house instead of towards it.

Problem: The retaining wall at the pond is failing, there is water leaking and the wall is cracked.
Solution: Possible the crack could be repaired with epoxy, my main concern is that if the wall fell, it could hurt someone real bad, but the chances are it will be a slow moving failure.

Problem: Water coming in chimney pipe in basement, they fill up a bucket and go dump the water.
Solution:
There are two chimney stack this water could be coming from, but they both have covers on them. I would assume that the water is coming into the pipe under ground somewhere.

Dig up and fill with concrete to stop leak.

Problem:
Back deck need to be torn down and replaced.

Water damage bottom of brick mold door at deck.
Solution:
Demo deck (summer group?) rebuild 10'x6' deck min because of doors.

Replace brickmold on door.

Problem: Front porch is in need of maintenance, beginning to get lots of mildew.
Solution: Pressure wash and paint porch.

Problem: Ramp @ front of house is in need of maintenance/repair, replace if needed.
Solution: Repair and paint ramp, I am on the fence about just replacing the whole thing. It is in better shape than the back deck but still poor condition.

Problem: Soft spots in living room floor, living room near kitchen, and hallway leading to bedroom. These spots are covered with carpet.
Solution: Pull up carpet and repair floors, replace carpet with linoleum or LVL flooring.

Problem: Low access jacuzzi tub in master bath, She can not use it because of large bulky threshold.
Solution: Replace with low threshold unit, this is larger than any standard size tub.

Problem: Master bath toilet is leaking and has been shut off.
Solution: Replace toilet with new wax ring and supply lines, repair any subfloor water damage that is needed.

Problem: There is a leak at exhaust fan in 1/2 bath. Water damage at ceiling.
Solution: Looks like a consistent leak to me, needs to be repaired on the outside, possibly need to replace boot and/or fan.

Problem: Water leak at washing machine.
Solution: Replace 1/2" pex shutoff valve

Problem: Underpinning removed by plumbers.
Solution: Replace underpinning once repair work is done.

Problem: Many outlets and switches with no covers. Also some outlets don't work.
Solution: Send electrician to replace outlets as needed, install covers as needed.

Problem: Only bathroom is in very poor condition. Once water is fixed, it would be nice to get the bathroom remodeled.
Solution: floor, sink, vanity, toilet, and shower are all in rough condition, and she needs grab bars in there as well

Problem: Back door need to be replaced, you can see daylight on the hinge side.
Solution: Replace mobile home door.

Problem: Back landing and steps are rotten and unpassable.
Solution: Rebuild landing and steps with handrail.

Problem: No primary heat source, the furnace was disconnected from the duct work and the thermostat by who ever did her floors in the past.
Solution: The furnace looks very old, even if it works, I would recommend a newer system for her, possible a mini split.

Problem: Her primary water source is a well, it is not functioning. The lines under the house are busted after the freeze.
Solution: Get a plumber out there to repair lines as needed and trouble shoot/restart well service.

Problem:
The windows are fogging up and Fred would like to replace the ones in Joan's room so she can see outside.

He is willing to buy some windows if someone can come install them.
Solution: I told him I could install the windows but to wait because they may be an ESFR candidate.

Problem: Joan has very low mobility and Fred said her carries her to the car when she has to go to the doctor. They do not have a ramp or a wheel chair but need both.
Solution: Build a ramp at front porch. It will need to be approx 42 feet long to maintain 1"per foot. There is plenty of room to make a one switchback ramp here.

Problem: Front porch roof plywood is rotting on sections that are basically flat.
Solution: Roof needs to be repaired on sides of front porch, create more pitch if possible.

Problem: Door leaks water around the perimeter gasket which is dry rotted.
Solution: Replace door and new gasket.

Problem: There is some water damage and mold around the top of master shower stall.
Solution: Re-Paint

Problem: Linoleum flooring is cracking in kitchen and there is a bad spot in bedroom.
Solution: Repair floor as needed.

Problem: Gutters are plastic and failing in general. Some down spouts are missing, also the sub fascia was never trimmed or wrapped and now it all has water damage.
Solution: Replace sub fascia as needed and cover with metal, install new gutters.
Contractor: JAS (Mars Hill) Hardware (dba JAS of Weaverville)

Problem: The roof appears to be lacking valley flashing at the front porch addition. It is leaking. It is also leaking into the kitchen ceiling.
Solution: The roof will have to be re-done with the correct flashing pieces. At this time, I would assume there is lots of water damage to the plywood.
Contractor: JAS (Mars Hill) Hardware (dba JAS of Weaverville)

Problem: Oil furnace no longer works efficiently, smells and very noisy.
Solution: Replace with new efficient heat pump

Problem: Back steps rotten and unsafe.
Solution: Rebuild with new steps and handrail.

Problem: Lottie only has wood heat and a heart condition which makes using the cookstove difficult. She has a monitor heater in the basement which is currently not working and only heats downstairs area.
Solution: Install ducts and efficient heat pump

Problem: Water heater is sitting on a rotten platform.
Solution: Darrow has a new water heater, just needs someone to install it.

Problem:
Only one way in and out. Front porch door is only egress.

There is a door to nowhere in the wood stove room.
Solution: Build landing and steps at wood stove room, or possibly add a back door at bedroom window for emergency egress.

Problem: Oil tank leaking into yard.
Solution: Fix the fitting that is leaking.

Problem: Sub floor is caving in at the fridge and water heater. Water heater falling over.
Solution: Kitchen and bedroom need new subfloor, the joists are giving way to termite and water damage over the years.

Problem: Revonda has a standard bathtub and she can't safely get in and out.
Solution: Modify bathtub to low threshold.
Contractor: Independent Living through NC Vocational Rehab

Problem: Pretty bad roof leak in the wood stove room. The smoke stack could be part of the problem but it is a very flat roof.
Solution: Revonda says she is not opposed to omitting the stove stack in order to fix the leak, but it is a very flat section and may need a membrane instead of metal.

Problem: Interior electrical panel has lots of corrosion on the contacts.
Solution: Replace indoor electric service.

Problem: Massive leak in the roof but it is over the "garage" area, not a heated living space.
Solution: The entire roof needs replaced.

Problem: Darrow is washing dishes in the bathtub. He has a new sink and faucet, pipe, fittings, and glue. Needs help installing new sink, and water line to the sink.
Solution: Help install sink, run (pex?) water line to sink?

Problem: Hot water heater is leaking at the base.
Solution: Needs to be replaced due to old age and the bottom being rusted through.

Problem: Water heater is old and was bought used. No pan underneath.
Solution: Install new water heater with pan underneath.

Problem: No exterior door at Kitchen/front porch. There are only storm doors.
Solution: Install a 2-8 exterior door.

Problem: Needs to be insulated somehow, the attic has been blown but the walls are without.
Solution: Blown in cellulose?

Problem: Missing viynl siding in several spots on home, they could not afford to finish the job.
Solution: finish vinyl sidiing

Problem: Roof leak over kitchen/porch area. Very old roof, has been painted several time over the years.
Solution: Perhaps it can be sealed once more, Certainly it needs to be replaced soon, and Richard is okay with omitting the 3 chimneys if we get to that point.

Problem: Yvonne has a hard time in her bathroom with her toilet and getting in and out of shower.
Solution: Needs bathroom modifications. Possibly including widening of her doorway leading into the bathroom.

Problem: Though a summer group repaired the roof, Debra says when it rains hard she still has a leak in her bathroom.
Solution: Needs new metal roof

Problem: Smell when hot water is used.
Solution: Install new alloy anode rode

Problem: Kitchen cabinet and chair need repaired. Simple task will small amount of time.
Solution: Glue chair leg and clamp, re-attach cabinet door hardware.

Problem: Back deck with steps needs to be replaced. Broken steps and rotting deck.
Solution: Replace with 4x8 deck, handrail, and steps.

Problem: Mailbox numbers are faded and can't be read.
Solution: Put some numbers on her mailbox.

Problem: Fascia is starting to rot and there are no gutters.
Solution: Replace all fascia when roof is done, and decide if it needs gutters, there is erosion in the yard from not having gutters.

Problem: Porch handrail and flooring are in bad shape. Hand rails are broken or loose in several spots. Lots of soft flooring.
Solution: Replace/repair as needed.

Problem: Roof leaking, most likely at ridge, it is very rusty up there.
Solution: Maybe it could be patched and repainted as a temporary fix, but otherwise it needs to be replaced.

Problem: kitchen sink cabinet is starting to collapse from water damage.
Solution: Replace kitchen sink and cabinet.

Problem: Water damage in walls.
Solution: Repair where needed.

Problem: Breaker box has taken considerable water damage and the wall it is in is rotten. There are mice that are chewing on stuff as well.
Solution: I would like for a electrician to make a visit and assure us that wiring is safe.

Problem: Back bathroom has broken drain and supply lines and has been disconnected. I could not reach the bathroom due to floor caving in.
Solution: Bath remodel and plumbing repair.

Problem: Almost entire subfloor has taken on water damage and is soft and actually scary in spots, I almost fell through back bedroom.
Solution: New plywood, framing where needed, vinyl click floating floor.

Problem: Back door has major water damage and has been screwed shut.
Solution: Replace door.

Problem: Trailer roof leaking everywhere at the edges. Water damage in every room in ceiling, walls, and floor.
Solution: Needs Kool Sealing or a new roof, there are porch roofs attached to the trailer that need be demolished, or repaired and incorporated into new roof system.

Problem: John McLung roofing did her roof 13 years ago and she says it has leaked every since. Been patched several times but now she has two skylights that are leaking.
Solution: Debbie is OK with omitting the skylights, roof needs a lot of work, shingles are in decent condition but decking and framing may need some attention.

Problem: They have installed a grab bar in her bathroom but I thinks she needs more.
Solution: Install grab bars where needed.

Problem: Altha has poor mobility and her son/son's have to help her in and out of the house, she has fallen in the past trying to get down steps.
Solution: Build a ramp in the back so they can use her wheelchair to get her in and out of the house.

Problem: The bath tub is too high for Amanda to lift her son into for bathing and causing accessibility issues.
Solution: Have walk in shower installed.

Problem: Deck near driveway is rotten, steps need to be replaced.
Solution: Steps were replaced. Not all deck boards were replaced and could be in the future.

Problem: Front door landing and steps have collapsed into a pile.
Solution: Rebuild a 4x4 landing and ramp going towards the parking area.

Problem: Lot has junk cars and debris everywhere, there is no parking and no room for a dumpster.
Solution: Get junk cars removed so there is room for parking and a dumpster.

Problem: Christie is on shared spring with her mother, Eulalia (also CHC client). There is very little water that comes out. Need a plumber go out and determine if it is the bladder tank, pressure switch, flow of spring itself or something else.
Patricia's bathroom needs a few grab bars, at shower and toilet.
Solution: Install grab bars.

Problem: Front door was kicked in from a robbery and jamb is broken.
Solution: Replace 32x76 storm/front door combo unit, swings in to the right.

Problem: Steps on front porch are half rotten and starting to fall apart.
Solution: Rebuild 2 sets of steps on front porch with handrail, approx 32" rise.

Problem: Nellie paid a roofer to put new metal on less than 7 years ago. The metal when installed was cut too short and now the plywood underneath is rotting. Screws are backing out of metal, needs new gutters.
Solution: Demo existing roof, repair plywood and framing as needed, install underlayment and ice and water shield where needed, install new gutters and downspouts.

Problem: Has new well pump but installation did not include a cover.
Solution: Install fake rock cover with some insulation.

Problem: Roof has been leaking several times, current patch job is holding but it is very old tin roof.
Solution: Remove tin, repair roof decking as needed, install new roof.

Problem: The roof look has done serious damage to room below it.
Solution: Wall, ceiling, and floor will have to be repaired once we are able to get in there and do some work.

Problem: Kathy's brother built a ramp out front for her, just need a handrail.
Solution: Build handrail on ramp.

Problem: Front door is damaged and can see daylight almost all around it.
Solution: Recommend replace door with 32" exterior door (6'8")

Problem: Siding is incomplete.
Solution:
They have some siding on site, but job needs to be cleaned up enough to safely work on first.

Install siding/cover exposed wood.

Problem: Flat part of roof is leaking bad.
Solution:
Most of the house has old shingles on it, some of it has new metal but I'm not sure about the installation of it.

I recommend to send a contractor out there and have them decide how much to replace.

Problem: Ed's has a shower chair and a toilet topper but he needs grab bars and a low rise shower stall. He is currently climbing over a standard tub threshold to bath.
Solution:
Bathroom needs some love, not sure how far we can go past repairing sub floor, will discuss at triage.

  

Redo bathroom.

Problem: Front door has damaged threshold and he has to keep a towel there to block cold air.
Solution: Replace 32" x 78" trailer door

Problem: Edward has back problems and sleeps on an old couch, he wants to replace that couch but needs help removing it from the home.
Solution: Move couch out of house and haul to dump.

Problem: Ed uses a wheelchair when he leaves the house but has no ramp.
Solution: Small ramp to driveway at back door, would be not more than 6 ft long.

Problem: Kitchen floor is very soft especially at sink/stove area.
Solution: Replace subfloor plywood and repair any framing that is bad, finish floor with linoleum or vinyl flooring.

Problem: Leak around pipe boots and one chimney.
Solution: Roof appears to still be in good condition. Flash both chimneys on metal roof and install new pipe boots.

Problem: Back bedroom floor soft from a prolong roof leak. Hole in floor.
Solution: Install new subfloor and possibly some new joists will be needed. Install vinyl plank flooring.

Problem: Water heater is outdated and has visible rust stains on the front.
Solution: Install new hot water heater.

Problem: Holes in bathroom floor. Entire bathroom floor is failing. Subfloor needs to be repaired. Shower/tub covered with mold, toilet about to fall through the floor. Vanity falling apart.
Solution: Remove everything including subfloor and replace with new flooring, toilet, shower and vanity. New insulation in floor and walls, new subfloor and siding. Install energy efficient exhaust fan.

Problem: Door threshold at bedroom door is too high for walker and it is damaged from being stepped on so many times.
Solution: Redo landing outside to be flush with bottom of door, it is concrete slab. Either it has to be demolished or built up higher with wood.

Problem: Front gutter hanging low and leaking.
Solution: Replace with seamless gutter.

Problem: 6x6 posts rotting at the base because they extend to below slab.
Solution: Tear into walls, cut out rotten part, form around it and inject form with concrete.

Problem: Front porch decking and framing are rotting out due to it being built on the ground.
Solution: Needs some decking and framing repaired/replaced, possibly needs some digging out to prevent same thing from happening again.

Problem: Screen Door on back porch needs some work.
Solution: Door is out of whack and can probably just be adjusted.

Problem: Sink in hallway bathroom is leaking at trap.
Solution: Replace trap and possible sink seal.

Problem:
underpinning is being pushed out of place by erosion.

Lawn work needed
Solution:
redo underpinning the correct way.

Clean up lawn

Problem: Both front porch and back deck need attention.
Solution:
Back deck needs new decking boards and possibly replace handrail.

Front porch has a bad ramp on it, needs to be replaced.

Problem: Roof leaking at furnace area.
Solution: Shingles are pretty aged on trailer, maybe time for a metal roof.

Problem: Terry lives in a camper with membrane roof and it is leaking everywhere.
Solution: He has added metal roof, tarps, ect. But wants to move camper to family land, after that maybe we can build a carport over it.

Problem: 2 cracks in foundation near driveway corner of house.
Solution: Looks like the house had settled causing the cracks, structurally I think it is fine, Seal them up with mortar.

Problem: Chimney in living room takes on water when it rains.
Solution: It's an old stone chimney but maybe it could have a metal cover attached to it. Probably would have to be custom made.

Problem: Front and back doors are 100+ years old and do not function very well.
Solution:
They could be replaced but height restrictions may require custom door.

36" front door 6'6" tall

30" back door 6'4" tall

Problem: Soft floor front porch where the ramp is, to the left of the door, facing house.
Solution: Repair porch floor with new plywood or decking boards.

Problem: Very old metal roof and it is leaking in kitchen in two different spots.
Solution: Needs to be replaced before water damage becomes a problem.

Problem: Front porch needs to be painted
Solution: Paint front porch

Problem: No insulation in attic.
Solution: Blow in insulation to R-38

Problem: There is not a handicap accessible restroom.
Solution: Install ADA commode, grab bars and walk in shower with moen valves.

Problem: Oil furnace has been out of commission for 5 years.
Solution: Needs service, nozzles are probably clogged, he does have gas heat that he has been using for years.

Problem: Shower stall is cracked.
Solution: Needs to be repaired or replaced, other bath has a high threshold to step over.

Problem: Front and back steps have sun and water damage, and 7.5" rise.
Solution: Jeff needs them to be low rise steps so both need to be replaced.

Problem: Hole in bathroom floor/closet floor and walls.
Solution: Remove any carpets and replace subfloor particle board with plywood, vinyl click flooring or linoleum.

Problem: Shingles are very deteriorated and roof is leaking in back bedroom/closet/bathroom.
Solution: Needs new roof.

Problem: Front porch is concrete slab that has many potholes in it, tripping hazard, ankle breaker.
Solution: Needs to be jack hammered up and re-poured.

Problem: Front Door is very hard to close and has been kicked in.
Solution: Replace door and jamb.

Problem: Roof in completely degrading and water damage through out roof framing.
Solution: Demolish and replace entire roof, if the framing can be saved that is fine but it's all nominal rough cut lumber, plywood is probably all bad.

Problem: Gutter over front porch entrance not functioning properly, has fall in wrong direction. fills with water and spills over.
Solution: Redo gutter or add downspout to the end.

Problem: Some outlets that only work intermittently.
Solution: Replace outlets.

Problem: Bathtub has hole in it, has been patched before.
Solution: Need new 30x54 showertub installed.

Problem: Front Porch steps are in bad shape, handrail falling off.
Solution: Rebuild steps and hand rail.

Problem: Major erosion problem directly behind house, possible another spring there. Broken shale erosion problem just like Janice Arringtons house.
Solution: Dig out dirt that has moved and install French drain in back and side of house.

Problem: Has shower threshold to step over.
Solution: Replace with low threshold shower.

Problem: Creek water is polluting her spring water.
Solution: Needs a well, or new spring setup.

Problem: Roof is on the verge of leaking
Solution: Put a metal roof on

Problem: Original metal roof leaking is leaking and damaging walls of mobile home.
Solution: replace with new metal roof

Problem: Shirley's front door does not close properly, and she needs a storm door.
Solution: Install door and storm door.

Problem: Front door gets hung on floor as it opens.
Solution: may be able to trim door enough to get clearance, if not it would have to become an outswing door.

Problem: Roof has leak in kitchen, most likely from dry rotted marine screws. Leak causing rotten plywood.
Solution: Replace metal roof and address replace new plywood as needed.

Problem: Client is elderly and is requesting a ramp because she has a hard time using the stairs. They do not want the ramp to come off of the front porch where Altha likes to sit.
Solution:
Build a ramp off the side porch. There is currently a small set of stairs that can easily be removed.

I suggest we build a platform coming directly off the porch, approximately 4x8ft and then run the ramp along side the house. The rise of the porch is appropriately 27 inches which would mean our ramp would be 27 feet long. That would place the bottom of the ramp just at the corner of the front of the house which will be easy for Altha to access.

*** Note that the septic tank is right near the proposed site and its exact location should be checked before construction begins***

Problem: Insects have eaten away at her porch post.

Problem: Fascia board and Soffit are rotting through out the home.

Problem: Multiple soggy areas in the floor inside.

Problem: Ceiling Light hangs low in the center of the room over the bed causing issues of movement.

Problem: Ceiling in master bedroom caved in.

The tapestries used as covering on the ceiling will need to be removed to see if any ceiling joists need to be replaced. Replace any that are damaged or deteriorating. Install cherry boards. Finish boards with some coating that is Low VOC (Ask client for preference), Put up Trim around the perimeter of the ceiling.

Problem: Roof is soggy throughout. Large portion of roof is covered by a tarp, over the master bedroom.
