Problem: Shower pan in primary bathroom is cracked and leaking. Jay tried using an epoxy to seal the crack and that seemed to work well for awhile. He said he's not able to clean near the epoxy for fear of it coming off.
Solution: Tear out old mobile home shower stall and install a new one.

Problem: Her home is dangerous and there are too many repairs to make it a safe place to live.
Solution: Provide a new home for her to live in.

Problem: Front right deck corner is not supported by a concrete block
Solution: Jack up the porch about an inch from where it currently sits. Clear out the area underneath the post and level a pad large enough to fit half of a cap block. Lower the deck down onto the caps blocks by releasing the jack slowly.

Problem: Portions of the facia on the back of the house have rotted and need to be replaced. Gutters are also missing from the back of the house and need to be installed while working on the facia.
Solution: Replace rotten facia and install gutters/downspouts on the back of the home

Problem: Back deck and wooden walkways are failing due to the bank eroding during heavy rain events.
Solution: tear off back deck and walk way. Install railroad tie terraces behind the home to prevent the slope from further eroding. Rebuild a simple 8 x 8 deck and stairs down to the driveway.

Problem: Electrical load/demand in the house is greater than what the box can handle according to Caryn
Solution: Consult with an electrician to determine best course of action

Problem: No safety railings around stair opening on second floor - very dangerous
Solution: Install a safety railing around the stair opening

Problem: Windows are very inefficient and Caryn's electrical bill will sometimes top $600.00
Solution: Install new insulated/double pane windows throughout the home

Problem: Grey water for the house (sinks, tubs and showers) runs out into a ditch to the left of the driveway. The grey water ponds in this area and rarely dries up/drains - mosquitos and gnat issues in the warmer months
Solution: Connect the showers/tubs, sinks to the septic tank or enquire about installing a grey water pit that will properly drain. Cost is a major unknown with this repair.

Problem: Minor plumbing issues in the home. Shower fixture downstairs sprays outward and it's unclear if the water is leaking back into the wall. Kitchen sink drain leaks and needs to be replumbed using PVC and replace cabinet floor while plumbing is torn out. Caryn is also concerned that the washing machine may not be hooked up to any plumbing. She said it sounds like water is flowing under the house when the washer drains.
Solution: Replace the plumbing fixture in the shower and plumb properly. Replace drain in kitchen and install a new cabinet floor out of 1/2" plywood. Verify that the washing machine drains out to the grey water pit

Problem: Old 5V metal roof is leaking in a few spots mainly in the living room. The roof already has a layer of KoolSeal on it.
Solution: Tear off old 5V metal roof and replace with a 50 year painted Tuff Rib metal roof or equivalent. Replace plumbing boots and flashing around chimney.

Problem: Monitor heater not functioning.
Solution: Repair.

Problem: Ember's pipe burst and her hot water heater stopped working. The water heater is over 25yrs old and should be replaced rather than repaired. She currently does not have running water to her home.
Solution: Repair broken plumbing in crawlspace and replace 40 gallon water heater.

Problem: Broken storm windows
Solution: See if suitable replacements can be located - the storm windows are approximately 25" wide x 26" high. One of the windows fell out of the track and it may just need to be repaired.

Problem: Front steps and railings are becoming very unsafe for Shelby who is 84
Solution: Install a 1/12 handicap ramp constructed from PT lumber on the front of the home and the ramp should land near her parking area. The ramp will need to be approximately 33' long and may need a switchback to fit in the allotted space.

Problem: Gutters on front and back of home need to be replaced
Solution: Replace any rotten 1x4 facia with PT 1x4 and paint white to match. Install 40' of 5" white K-style gutters on the front and 40' on the back of the home. Reinstall/reuse 2 x 3 downspouts if possible.

Problem: Son's window is leaking and causing the sill to rot
Solution: Install a new energy efficient window

Problem: Insulation missing from underneath home
Solution: install r-19 faced batt fiberglass insulation underneath home (approx 1400 sqft). Make sure faced portion is up against the subfloor. Approx 32 rolls will be needed. Secure Insulation in place with strapping

Problem: Multiple holes in drywall and walls throughout home
Solution: patch holes as needed throughout home, repaint and seal

Problem: Single pane glass back door is sweating and molding
Solution: Replace back door with new energy efficient half light double pane glass door - 32" x 82" door

Problem: Bathtub and surround are leaking badly. Tub is cracked
Solution: Replace tub and surround - Tub is standard size 60"

Problem: ***This is such a large job the full scope/cost is a best guess*** Excess moisture underneath home has contributed to extensive rot to the flooring system in almost half of the home. One of the main beams under the home has already failed and the floor is bowed in an approximately 14' x 36' (500 - 550sqft) section of the house encompassing the living room, dining room and a part of a closet. Extensive mold growth was found underneath of the house. The home does not appear to have had a vapor barrier in the crawlspace.
Solution: Tear out the rotten portions of the floor, sill plates, rim joists, studs, etc. and rebuild the flooring system using pressure treated lumber. Install a 6 mil vapor barrier underneath the home and re-insulate the floors. Place high quality OSB (Advantech 3/4) subfloor over the joists and install a finished floor. The rest of the crawlspace will likely need mold remediation and proper ventilation.

Problem: Wood stove mat in the living room is torn and sharp metal sticks up and has cut Ashley. Ember has the new fireproof mat but cannot move the stove to replace it.
Solution: Get two strong backs to replace wood stove protective mat.

Problem: In need of a ramp. Per conversation with home health worker, Lynn Wood, Judy had to take 3 breaks from car to porch just navigating steps, she is very easily winded.
Solution: A ramp would not be very difficult to build here. Discuss further at Client Triage.

Problem: Window is leaking under the AC in the living room
Solution: Seal/flash the window as necessary to prevent moisture from entering the home. Installing a roof with an overhang should really help or solve this issue.

Problem: Back stairs have failed and need to be replaced
Solution: Install a new set of stairs with a minimum 4' x 4' porch and concrete landing pad

Problem: Roof is leaking and is original to the mobile home (1999)
Solution: Install a new metal roof with 10" - 12" overhangs - home is 64 x 14 with a 3/12 pitch

Problem: Last group of volunteers threw away the screens on her windows
Solution: See if we can find some new screens for some of her windows

Problem: Shower surround has a gap and water leaks down around the edges of the tub
Solution: Seal around the tub with silicone caulk so that water is not able to reach the particle board subfloor

Problem: Exterior lights are not working
Solution: Replace older light with a new exterior light

Problem: Betty needs help clearing brush and briars around her well house and on the hill above her home
Solution: See if a volunteer would go by and help her clear the brush or this would make a great low skill NHN project

Problem: Back porch and ramp needs to be re-worked. Ramp is very unsafe. Christopher was in a wheel chair for several years after a surgery and someone constructed this ramp for him. It really needs to be replaced with a set of stairs or a 1 in 12 ramp for the future. The back porch needs to be pressure washed and any rotten wood needs to be replaced.
Solution: Pressure wash back porch and replace any rotten lumber. Remove ramp and install a new ramp or a set of stairs

Problem: Bathroom faucet is broken. Christopher is extremely strong and doesn't know his own strength sometimes. He accidently broke the faucet
Solution: Install a new bathroom faucet

Problem: Kitchen faucet hot water knob is broken
Solution: Install a new kitchen faucet

Problem: Floors in the living room around the windows are rotting out due to leaky windows
Solution: tear up wet/rotten/spongy flooring and repair joists as well as subfloor. Install finished floor to match

Problem: Back door is falling apart and needs to be replaced
Solution: Purchase a new mobile home door and install

Problem: Front door needs to be replaced
Solution: Purchase a new mobile home door and install

Problem: Leaky roof without overhangs/eaves is allowing water to enter the home around the edges of the mobile.
Solution: Install a new roof with at least 10" - 12" of overhang to keep water from entering along the edges of the roofline. This should also keep water off the windows, which are also leaking badly and causing the floors to rot

Problem: Water is leaking in around the ceiling of the bump out in the basement. I was not able to see exactly where the water was coming from, but it appears that this addition/bump out was improperly flashed. The metal flashing was put underneath of the asphalt shingles. You can see evidence of the water along the beam in basement.
Solution: Work to determine the exact source of the water entering the basement ceiling along the beam. I do not think it's coming from the siding unless the home is not sheathed or wrapped underneath the wood siding.

Problem: 2nd story Window frame is leaking and water is entering the interior of the home. Rupa also thinks that water is getting behind the siding of the home and that could only happen if the home is not sheathed. I was not able to tell if the home was sheathed or wrapped to prevent water from entering behind the siding.
Solution: Will need a really long extension ladder or scaffolding to reach the window. It's approximately 20 - 25 feet off the ground. The window frame needs to be thoroughly sealed with silicon caulk to prevent water from entering the interior of the home.

Problem: Bronson would like the carpet replaced in his home with some type of laminate flooring. He seems capable of doing it on his own with some help. This could be a great ESFR project
Solution: Remove carpet, padding and tack strips. Install new laminate flooring in their home

Problem: Insulation is falling out from underneath their home
Solution: Install new insulation under their home

Problem: Rita and Bronson's Oil furnace is not working because a flex duct pipe in their crawlspace has broken. All of the heat is blowing directly into the crawlspace and Bronson is not able to make the repair himself
Solution: Hire an HVAC company to make repairs to their oil furnace and service it before winter arrives

Problem: Extensive mold growth in several rooms of the house
Solution: May need to look into mold remediation after the roof is completed so Mickey can stay in her home

Problem: Mickey would like to use the woodstove and there is an issue with the flue inside the home
Solution: See if we have a volunteer that is knowledgeable with wood stoves and sealing off flues to help her out

Problem: Ceiling needs to be pulled down inside the home where the roof is leaking and wiring needs to be replaced to prevent a fire
Solution: Tear down the ceiling the portions of the home where water is actively leaking and replace electrical wiring that has gotten wet. This should only happen after the roof is replaced. I'm just guessing a cost for this one no idea.

Problem: Flat roof is leaking and causing major water damage in the home. Roof is leaking really badly and water sometimes fills up the globes around the light fixtures in the home, which could cause an electrical short. The mold growth in several of the rooms is deeply concerning and creating a serious indoor air quality issue.
Solution: 5V metal needs to be pulled off the home and replaced with galvalume on the steeper pitched portions of the roof and a membrane needs to be used on the flat roof sections around the home.

Problem: Front porch is rotting and needs to be replaced.
Solution: Replace front porch with pt lumber

Problem: Major roof leak that is causing serious interior damage to their home. The leak is causing/creating electrical issues, structural issues and serious mold growth. They had to move their daughter's bedroom to another area of the house due to mold. Not a good situation and it needs to be addressed asap.
Solution: The size and scope of this issue is truly unknown to make it right so The Curtioff's can have a healthy home. The roof needs to be completely replaced, reflashed and properly sealed by a professional. Any rotten wood on the roof sheeting needs to be replaced as well. It's a massive project and will be incredibly expensive due to the extent of the water damage. They were quoted $15,000 by a roofing professional for a new roof.

Problem: Window frame in primary bedroom is rotten
Solution: Replace window and frame

Problem: Railing needed for walk up attic stairs
Solution: Install a handrail for the attic stairs.

Problem: Fuel oil furnace is not working and they only have a wood stove as their source of heat.
Solution: They did not express an interest in getting the fuel oil furnace working again I only wanted to add a note about it. They seem to prefer wood heat.

Problem: Electrical panel needs upgrading
Solution: Hire an electrician to upgrade the service panel for the home and address any electrical issues that arise from the job

Problem: Repair damage in walkup attic stairwell from roof leak after the roof is repaired.
Solution: Open up the walls and replace any wet or rotted materials. The extent of the damage is completely unknown.

Problem: Dangerous basement stairs - no railings
Solution: Install handrails on the basement stairs

Problem: Bacteria in the well water causing strong odors and discoloration on plumbing fixtures (tub, sink, toilet)
Solution: I suggested that they look into an aerator system since the bacteria in their well is probably anaerobic. I also suggested that they add in a three stage filtration system.

Problem: Bathroom needs total remodel after water quality problem is fixed (see other repair referencing water issue)
Solution: tear out bathroom to studs and replace all fixtures, flooring, trim, etc.

Problem: Several of the new windows in the home have been improperly installed and trimmed. The windows are drafty.
Solution: Remove trim around the windows and install spray foam (if none is present) and then re trim the window

Problem: They would like their spring revamped and looking for someone to help out
Solution: See if we have a volunteer that is familiar with heading up and repairing spring boxes

Problem: Exterior wood (facia, window trim, porch etc..) needs to be repainted
Solution: repaint the wood exterior on the home - no sanding or scraping!

Problem: Install a new back exterior door before winter comes. Their laundry is on this back porch and the water froze this past winter, which led to busted pipes.
Solution: Install a new back exterior door on the home

Problem: No vapor barrier underneath the crawlspace portion of the house
Solution: Install a 6mil vapor barrier underneath the crawlspace portion of the home

Problem: Multiple strange septic/grey water/black water issues going on with the home. The grey water from the kitchen sink and laundry is straight piped into the creek. They also suspect that the bathroom may be straight piped as well. They think there is a holding tank/septic tank and there are no leech lines. I told them that we could submit a request to Environmental Health to see if there were any septic permits on file. Given the age of the house it's unlikely that there is a drawing.
Solution: Nothing to do right now just need to be aware of the issues referenced above.

Problem: The plumbing in the house is extremely old and is cast iron. No shutoff valve for water being supplied to The Farm Connection
Solution: Hire a plumber to install a shutoff valve to The Farm Connection and troubleshoot any other plumbing issues. They were told by other plumbers not to touch the cast iron pipes given their age. It may be time to replumb the entire house with PEX.

Problem: Given the steep pitch of the roof the gutters are too small to handle all of the water coming off the roof.
Solution: Install new 5" - 6" gutters and larger downspouts to better manage the amount of water being shed by the roof. Install plastic corrugated pipes at the end of the downspouts and run them out away from the house. The clay drainage pipes have deteriorated over time and no longer draining properly.

Problem: The roof is shingles on the front and metal on the back. There is an active roof leak in the valley above the porch and it's leaking into the walls of the walkup attic stairwell.
Solution: Install metal roofing on the front of the home to match the back half.

Problem: No railings on the front porch very unsafe
Solution: Install front railings on the porch and brace up the porch. No need to replace the entire porch at this time

Problem: Poor drainage underneath the mobile home and there is a drainage pipe that floods the lot during heavy rain events. The home would benefit from a vapor barrier and new insulation underneath
Solution: install 6 mil vapor barrier and new insulation underneath the floor

Problem: Active roof leak in small back right bedroom.
Solution: The water is most likely coming in from one of two vents about the bedroom. Clean out around the vents and lay down a thick layer of roofing tar or Through The Roof to hopefully stop this leak before it gets worse. The rest of the roof appears fine and there is a large number of roof penetrations. Any one of these vents could start leaking in the near future.

Problem: Light shorted out in the bedroom (only known electrical issue)
Solution: Hire an electrician to troubleshoot the issue and replace the fixture with a new one

Problem: Kitchen sink leaking into bucket
Solution: Repair plumbing issues underneath the sink

Problem: Hallway bathroom floor is extremely rotted and unsafe
Solution: Tear out and remodel the entire bathroom

Problem: Furnace is not working and the only source of heat they have is electric space heaters
Solution: Hire an HVAC technician to come out and trouble shoot the furnace issues and go from there

Problem: Floor rotted in front of front door
Solution: Replace rotted portions of flooring, subfloor and joists in front of front door

Problem: Front door frame rotted and falling apart
Solution: Replace front door and framing

Problem: Jessica from APS has reported a crack in Candy's tub that has been a problem for a while, possibly a year and a half, and is causing water damage beneath the tub.
Solution: have David take a look and provide possible solution

Problem: Front gutter, over newly installed stairs, leaks. Beth believes it just needs to be cleaned out and seams sealed. She was adamant that this should be done from a ladder and no one should need to step on the porch roof.
Solution: Clean gutters and apply sealant to cracks where they are leaking.

Problem: Overgrown vegetation
Solution: Help Darci reclaim her yard from the weeds/kudzu. She said she had to let some things go with the house and this was one of them. She does have a goat on a portion of her property that keeps down some of the kudzu. Get with her in advance on how to address to suit her.

Problem: Exterior painting - Darci needs help finishing painting the house in the hard to reach higher places. Get with her in advance on picking out the correct colors - her home is incredibly colorful.
Solution: Finish painting the exterior of the home and front porch if Darci wants to address it. Do not scrape or sand any of the paint on the front porch until it's tested for lead based paint.

Problem: Front porch floor is spongy and needs to be rebuilt/better supported
Solution: Tear up flooring on the front porch and remove any rotted wood. Build the front porch back and paint and/or seal to suit homeowner

Problem: Gutters and downspouts are undersized for the amount of water the roof sheds during heavy rains.
Solution: Replace gutters with new 6" gutters and larger downspouts to handle the amount of water the steep roof sheds

Problem: Leaking roof - old 5v metal with many different patches. Roof leaks in several places during heavy rainfall event (bathroom and along the seam at one of the additions). Not extremely bad yet and want to address in the near future before it gets progressively worse.
Solution: Tear off existing 5v metal roof and replace with new galvalume panels, replace any rotten roof decking, flash and seal properly. Very complicated roof line and will require someone with expert level skill/knowledge of roofing.

Problem: Septic system is failing and Matthew Ponder has already been approached to make the needed repairs. The smaller doublewide sits lower than the septic tank and will most likely need some sort of pump to elevate the effluent from the home into the tank.
Solution: Repair septic system

Problem: Joyce does not have any firewood yet for the upcoming winter season
Solution: Make sure she has all the phone numbers for various organizations in our community that might be able to help her with firewood or see if a volunteer would be willing to bring her a load.

Problem: Front porch/addition is failing and needs a new set of stairs
Solution: Jack up the front porch and install pressure treated posts underneath to stabilize the post

Problem: Bedroom addition is failing and starting to sag badly
Solution: Need to support the bedroom from underneath with pressure treated posts or jack posts to stabilize the bedroom to keep the floor from failing

Problem: Roof is leaking in several different areas and the tin is extremely old. She would benefit greatly from a new roof, new flashing etc..Could make this repair part of the porch rebuild as well
Solution: Put new tin on the roof, new flashing etc..

Problem: Porch roof is failing
Solution: Rebuild the porch roof back to the same pitch, specs, etc...as the original roof

Problem: Flue needs to be cleaned prior to having a fire
Solution: Refer Joyce to a chimney sweep

Problem: Septic backs up into house during heavy rainfall event. An ex-boyfriend installed some sort of overflow pipe on the septic tank so it overflows into the ditch by her house.
Solution: Have septic tank pumped out and assess what the ex-boyfriend did to the tank while it's empty

Problem: rotten kitchen cabinet floor
Solution: replace rotten floor in cabinet with 1/2 inch plywood and repair leaks

Problem: Small bedroom needs a finished floor
Solution: Laminate flooring

Problem: Insulation needed under mobile home for 2 x 6 R 19 12 inch
Big Bedroom flooring and holes in the wall
Solution: finish floor in big bedroom and repair hole in the wall

Problem: Back door falling apart
Solution: Replace back door with new mobile home door

Problem: Back porch decking is completely rotten and needs to be replaced
Solution: Replace deck

Problem:
Bathroom Repairs:

Hole in the wall
Solution: Repair hole in the wall and repair linoleum by tub

Problem: Non functioning 14 year old heat pump. Lucille's heat pump went out a few months ago and she is very concerned about this upcoming winter. She does have a propane space heater in the living and it does not keep her entire house warm Lucille was quoted $7,000 for replacement parts or $10,000 for a new unit. All Ways Heating and Air in Asheville provided the quote and they also installed the unit 14 years ago.
Solution: Hire a different HVAC company to troubleshoot the issues with the heat pump. The entire unit is not functioning at all

Problem: No finished floor in the kitchen and living room - approx 14 x 30
Solution: Install LVT in the living room and kitchen

Problem: Washer and dryer are not working. Vivian goes to do laundry at her daughter's home in Weaverville. It's unclear if there is an electrical issue, plumbing issue or if the appliances are just shot
Solution: Spend more time figuring out the laundry issues

Problem: Toilet seal at the tank leaks badly in primary bathroom
Solution: rebuild/reseal the toilet from the tank up or purchase a replacement toilet

Problem: Primary bathroom - Vivian has purchased a large vanity from Habitat and the plumbing comes up through the floor
Solution: Will need to figure out a way for the vanity to accommodate the plumbing coming up through the floor. Otherwise the waste and supply lines will need to be re-plumbed through the wall.

Problem: OSB is failing underneath of the washer, dryer and fridge. The ex-son in-law may not have rested the OSB edges on the floor joists and it's causing the floor to flex under the weight of the appliances
Solution: Move the washer, dryer and fridge. Install new 3/4" Plywood on top of the floor joists

Problem: Living room wall will need to be re-insulated and drywalled when the window and door replace is complete
Solution: re-insulate wall cavity with fiberglass and drywall

Problem: Broken window in the living room by the front door is leaking considerable amounts of water during rain storms
Solution: Vivian is looking for a new window and will need help installing it because she does not have any tools. She refuses to purchase mobile home specific windows or doors due to the exorbitant cost associated with them. The framing will likely need to be modified to accommodate the window she purchases

Problem: Front door on the home is leaking badly during rain events and needs to be replaced/reflashed etc.
Solution: Vivian has already purchased a new standard sized door and is insisting on modifying the framing for the mobile home to make it fit. Her mobile home has regular 2 x 4 framing.

Problem: Small bedroom needs a door
Solution: Install a door for the small bedroom

Problem: Small bedroom has no finished flooring and is approximately 9 x 10
Solution: Install a finished floor in the small bedroom

Problem: Guest bathroom - tub and shower is hooked up and no water is being supplied
Solution: hire a plumber to trouble shoot the water supply issue in the guest bathroom

Problem: Guest bathroom toilet needs to be replaced or repaired - not working
Solution: Replace or attempt to repair the toilet in the guest bathroom

Problem: Guest Bath room needs the vanity hooked up. The vanity that Vivian purchased from Habitat only allows for the plumbing to enter the vanity through the back. The mobile home plumbing comes up through the floor
Solution: Work to see if the vanity that Vivian purchased can be modified to accommodate the plumbing coming through the floor. She seems insistent on using the vanity she purchased and it may not work without having to replumb the bathroom.

Problem: Bedroom 1 - Missing door
Solution: Install a bedroom door

Problem: Bedroom 1 - needs flooring approx 14 x 10
Solution: Install luxury vinyl tile in the bedroom 1

Problem: Two skylights in the home and the plastic has become very brittle. Only a matter of time before they start leaking and causing major water intrusion issues in the home
Solution: Vivian likes the natural light that the skylights give her in the bathrooms. She would prefer to have the skylights replaced

Problem: No handrails on the front porch
Solution: Add handrails made from pressure treated lumber

Problem: Back Deck is on blocks and is unstable
Solution: re-plumb the deck posts and add better cross braces

Problem: Shingle roof leak, neighbors have tried to repair and patch it. Membrane section is in great shape just the shingle roof needs repaired.
Solution: Replace with 40 architectural shingles.

Problem: Old carpet is trip hazard and exacerbates allergies
Solution: remove carpet and replace with laminate/vinyl flooring

Problem: Siding is coming loose on the backside of the house and birds/bees are building nests inside the void behind the siding
Solution: Reattach siding to seal with caulk to make sure no more insects or birds are able to gain entry

Problem: Waterline that supplies the ice maker in the freezer is leaking badly. Grover has to scrape out the ice weekly from the leaking line
Solution: Install a new water line from the sink to the freezer

Problem: Outlet in son's room is hanging out of the wall and needs to be repaired
Solution: Repair/replace outlet that's dangling out of the wall

Problem: Bottom of wall in guest bath is soft and falling apart due to previous leaks
Solution: Remove any rotten portions of the wall and build it back up with new lumber/drywall. Paint to match

Problem: Guest bathroom window will not crank closed
Solution: Contact Discount Mobile home supply to locate a suitable replacement window and install

Problem: Water issues have caused the laminate flooring in the kitchen to swell and buckle
Solution: Remove kitchen flooring and install new laminate flooring. Replace any rotten particle board subfloor with plywood

Problem: Mold growth behind the shower in the primary bathroom
Solution: Continue to monitor and clean as needed since it's in a very hard to reach area

Problem: Roof is deteriorating and leaking around the edges of the home. Skylight in bathroom is also causing issues.
Solution: Install a new metal roof over top of the trailer roof. The roof should have at least 6" of overhang to keep water off of the siding and a gutter/downspout system. Home is 14' x 80' and many of the problems inside of the house will be addressed simply by installing a new roof with overhangs.

Problem: Front door framing is rotten and needs to be repaired
Solution: Remove rotten framing elements including the floor and replace with new lumber. Re-install front door and re-screen storm door while doing this repair work

Problem: Janet only has one access point into her home through the front door. The back steps/porch are rotten and unsafe
Solution: install a new porch on the back of the house that Janet could use as a backup exit

Problem: Trees are leaning over her home and one large oak tree is dead. She is afraid it will fall on her house
Solution: See if a volunteer would be willing to trim and fell trees around her house

Problem: Rotten floor around shower in primary bathroom.
Solution:
Sub-floor has been repaired. The bathroom needs:

  * new shower kit & showerhead
  * drywall new partition wall
  * seal gaps between wall and subfloor with expanding foam
  * remove remaining old flooring & install new flooring & trim
  * Reconnect vent for shower & toilet to roof vent or install a studor vent with access panel
  * Patch holes in ceiling and closet drywall

Problem: Ground is slowly settling/sliding around the mobile home and starting to cause issues in the home.
Solution: Home needs to be lifted, releveled and set on new piers

Problem: Skylights in kitchen and primary bedroom have leaked in the past. Janet had someone spray flexseal around the flashing on top of the roof. This is only a temporary fix. The roof has been kool sealed multiple times. Roof is original from 1996
Solution: Remove skylights and install a new metal roof over the existing mobile roof. Home is 14' x 80' with a 3/12 pitched roof

Problem: Bathroom is extremely outdated and Julia has difficulty getting into the tub/shower. Toilet is also extremely low
Solution: Remodel the bathroom with a no curb shower, ADA toilets, etc...

Problem: Julia's late husband, Max, dug out under the addition of the home approximately 25 years ago and appears to have undermined the footers. The home has not settled in 25 years. The concern is that the soil below the footers will slough off and cause the walls to eventually fail. Max somehow was able to drive a tractor into the basement with a backhoe attached, knock a giant hole through a block wall and then start digging. It is an impressive sight to behold.
Solution: Consult with a structural engineer on the best way to proceed. Proper repair is potentially extremely expensive and may need to be stamped by an engineer.

Problem: Wall oven in the kitchen no longer functioning and Julia cannot bake anything. Her nephew brings her canned biscuits every other morning
Solution: Replace broken wall mount oven with a new one and make sure it's properly wired

Problem: Broken bottom sash on one of the back windows
Solution: Replace bottom sash with a matching replacement

Problem: Hot water heater is extremely old and near the end / passed it's life expectancy
Solution: Install a new hot water heater

Problem: Concrete stairs outside of the front door does not have a handrail
Solution: Install a grip-able handrail system along one side of the concrete stairs

Problem: Shingles overhanging the gutters in some areas. Gutters appear to be undersized for the size of the roof due to presence of efflorescence on the basement block walls
Solution: Install 6" gutter and downspout system to better handle water load from the roof

Problem: Washer and Dryer is located in the basement and needs to be moved upstairs. Basement stairs are unsafe for Julia to navigate. Sherry and Kelvin have a closet identified upstairs in and unfinished portion of the home that could easily accommodate a new washer/dryer setup
Solution: Install water lines and any necessary electrical runs to the closet upstairs. Should be easy to access through the floor since the basement is unfinished. Install dryer on the exterior wall to run vent.

Problem: 23+ year old shingled roof is deteriorating due to age and leaking around masonry chimney, which is causing the porch framing/soffit to rot. Shingles do not have much grit left and they are curling/snapping off because they've become very brittle.
Solution: Kelvin and Sherry would prefer that a metal roof be put directly over top of the shingles and not do a total tear off. Put metal directly over the shingles, trim, flash, etc. It appears that there are two layers of shingles on the house already.

Problem: septic backing up into basement
Solution: have septic company investigate and provide solution, as well as quote

Problem: Wood stove in the living room is very unsafe and rigged up with single wall pipe going out of the window
Solution: Remove wood stove or do a proper installation or install another type of heat in the home

Problem: Trash pickup
Solution: Trash pile is nearing the creek and needs to be picked up when deck is torn down. Rent several roll-off dumpsters and fill using volunteers

Problem: Back deck is unsafe and failing
Solution: Tear down old deck and replace with an 8 x 8 deck and stairs

Problem: Outlets on the back side of the home do not work at all
Solution: Have a licensed electrician evaluate the issue and make repairs

Problem: Kitchen floor is sagging and extremely soft in areas. Same repair will be needed in the kitchen as the back half of the trailer. The kitchen is approximately 14'x14'
Solution: Tear out rotten portions of the floor and repair/replace any rotten floor joists. Glue and screw down 3/4" Advantec subflooring then go back over the Advantec with a finished floor preferably laminate due to excessive moisture. They will need approximately 7 sheets of 3/4" Advantec, Subfloor glue, screws and laminate flooring

Problem: Entire back half of mobile home beyond the kitchen is unsafe and the floor is caving in. The particle board will need to be removed, any rotten floor joists and rotten flooring. It's unclear to me what caused this issue and the homeowner did not mention it. It is very moldy in this room and it's sealed off from the rest of the home.
Solution: Tammy said that if we got the materials ordered that she and her friends could complete all the work. The back half of the mobile home is approximately 14' x 20'. After the flooring systems and walls are repaired/ demoed they will need approximately 10 sheets of 3/4" Advanctec flooring, screws, subfloor glue and laminate flooring or some other flooring to finish the surface

Problem: Bathroom in mobile home portion is in terrible condition and needs to be remodeled completely
Solution: Completely remodel bathroom in mobile home portion from floor to ceiling. Bathroom is 55" x 88"

Problem: Tammy's washing machine won't drain anymore
Solution: See if a volunteer would be willing to help her get it working again or see if we can put her on a waiting list at ReClaim to purchase a working washer

Problem: Electrical issues in the home. Lights flickered several times while I was there and two outlets in the living room burned out/melted. She mentioned that she had to be careful about running her space heaters in the winter because the breakers tripped often
Solution: Have a licensed electrician evaluate and troubleshoot the issues in the home

Problem: Tammy does not have a reliable heat source and uses space heaters in the winter
Solution: Examine or spec out installing a new heating system. Her monitor heater does not work.

Problem: Tammy's water source is very unreliable and she had been out of water for several days when I visited. She would greatly benefit from her own private well.
Solution: Drill a new well and install pressure tank to ensure a reliable water source for the home

Problem: Kitchen sink is leaking badly underneath and has rotted out the cabinet
Solution: Repair leak under the kitchen sink and replace the bottom of the cabinet with plywood

Problem: House is settling in the middle of the structure causing cracks in the drywall and the windows are tough to close in the kitchen. Crawlspace door was not accessible when I was there evaluate. Her brother is going to trim and clean up around the house so we can get under the house.
Solution: Evaluate the settling issue from under the house when the crawlspace is accessible. May need to call in someone better suited to evaluate foundations.

Problem: Water is splashing off of the back porch onto the back door and siding causing excessive moisture/rot
Solution: Install a gutter or awning over back door/porch to prevent water from splashing off the porch and stairs

Problem: Back door frame has rotted along the bottom. Rot is moving into the flooring system and needs to be remediated.
Solution: Replace door and remove/replace any rotten wood.

Problem: Seals around vent and skylight are cracking. Grit on the shingles looks good and gutters are clean
Solution: Re-seal all roof penetrations and skylight. The skylight will most likely start leaking before anything does so really need to seal it well

Problem: Ditch to divert water flowing out of the narrow hollow above the house needs to be dug out and cleaned when fixing the back foundation wall
Solution: Use a mini excavator to clean out the ditch behind the house

Problem: Roof leaking around masonry chimney
Solution: Install a cricket and new metal flashing around the masonry chimney to divert water flow around the chimney

Problem: Kitchen door falling apart and not weather tight
Solution: Install a new exterior kitchen door that is weather tight

Problem: Front door falling apart and cold air seeps through during winter making the living room very cold
Solution: Install a new door and weather stripping

Problem: The narrow hollow behind Clifford's house flooded and water flooded the crawlspace in his home several years ago. The block wall on the back of the house is failing under soil pressure. Clifford had a friend excavate a ditch to collect any future flood events and divert the water flow into a culver that runs under his yard.
Solution: Excavate the back wall using a mini excavator to remove the soil pressure. Secure the block wall in the crawlspace using either a knee wall with steel or set steel into the wall to keep it from moving further. Install a french drain and back fill with gravel

Problem: Trap under the kitchen sink has leaked and ruined the bottom shelf in the cabinet
Solution: Replumb the kitchen sink so that it does not leak anymore. Remove the rotten wood in the cabinet base and install a piece of 1/2 inch plywood. The inside of the cabinet measures 22.5" deep x 35" wide

Problem: Toilet has leaked over the years in the spare bathroom off of the kitchen. The particle board has gotten saturated and the toilet is about to fall through the floor
Solution: Remove the toilet, linoleum, vanity, etc. and expose the floor joists. Put subfloor glue on the joists and install the new OSB subfloor. Install new linoleum over the OSB, reinstall vanity and put in a new toilet flange. The bathroom is 8' x 5'

Problem: Water lines underneath of the floor burst and got the particle board wet. The floor has fallen through and needs to be replace completely in this spare room
Solution: James has already purchased some new OSB subfloor. Cleanout the room and remove the existing particle board. Apply subfloor glue to the joists and screw down the new OSB sheets. Put a finished floor on top to complete the job - ask James what he prefers probably some type of laminate floor would be the way to go here. The room is approximately 10.5' x 10.5'

Problem: Loose boards on the bridge, many are rotten
Solution: Timberlok salvageable loose boards back onto bridge, consider replacing if it's in the budget.

Problem: Burned out outlet in kitchen hidden by picture
Solution: Cheryl mentioned that an outlet in her kitchen started smoking so she covered it up with a picture and no longer uses it

Problem: Cheryl really needs a new kitchen sink cabinet...her plumbing is exposed and she comments on how she can never get that area clean
Solution: Install a new kitchen cabinet with a sink

Problem: Woodstove in kitchen is too close to the wall and needs a heat shroud
Solution: build a heat shroud around the wood stove using 1/2 inch cement board, metal furring strips and roofing tin. Furring strips need to be approximately 1 inch and air needs to be able to flow behind the shroud keep 1 inch off the floor

Problem: House gets very cold in the winter time since it's on a north face and only has two wood stoves for heating such a large cut-up space.
Solution: Cheryl would really like central heating and air conditioning. At the very least some sort of heat solution so she doesn't have to deal with firewood anymore. One or two minisplits would be a major upgrade for them. They do have a monitor heater that is not installed and they're unsure if it works.

Problem: Insulation hanging down from under the house. Looks like almost all of the fiberglass batts have fallen down. Also, the back addition appears to have 2 x 4 floor joists so a high R value in the floor is going to be very difficult to achieve. Cheryl complained several times about how cold her house gets in the winter
Solution: Re-insulation the floor joists with fiberglass and use tie straps to hold it in place

Problem: Soft spot in kitchen from leak in ceiling
Solution: tear up linoleum and subfloor - replace wood and put back a finished floor as needed

Problem: Washing machine is hooked to a garden hose and freezes every winter
Solution: Re-plumb the laundry room and bring water up from the crawlspace if possible

Problem: Front porch is a work in progress and still somewhat dangerous despite ongoing work. Cheryl fell through it several years ago
Solution: Repair the front porch - fix the rotten porch roof, stairs, decking etc...

Problem: Cheryl's home is a 1970's (we think) mobile home with multiple additions/build-ons. The portion of the roof over top of the kitchen in the mobile home is deflecting and appears to be an active leak. I'm concerned under the weight of the build-over that the roof will eventually fail. There are areas on the roof where shingles are missing such as on the crest of the roof.
Solution: Need someone with more roofing experience to take a look at this. It looks very concerning to me with the amount of rainfall we've been getting

Problem: Alma would like all of her single pane windows replaced with more efficient double paned windows
Solution: replace single pane windows ( 10 windows on house not counting covered porch )

Problem: Gutters are messed up/bent and need to be replaced with some larger 5 or 6 inch gutters
Solution: Replace gutters and leaf guards for bigger 5 or 6 inch gutters w/leafguard

Problem: Screen door on the back of the house does not latch properly and swings open all the time
Solution: Re-work screen door latch to see if it can be repaired

Problem: Rotten wood on the ramp deck in a few places 1) in front of the screen door 2) at the bottom of the ramp where water has pooled in the past - her son spaced out the wood so that the water could drain
Solution: Replace rotten deck boards with new 2 x 6 PT SYP boards. Check at ReClaim in the back left corner for PT 2 x 6s before purchasing any new lumber

Problem: Single pane window above the air conditioner in the living room is cracked. The frame also appears to be rotting and in need of some new wood
Solution: Replace window and frame as necessary

Problem: Single Pane window in bedroom by the kitchen is cracked. Window frame appears to be rotten as well
Solution: Replace single pane window and frame as needed

Problem: Guest bathroom window has a busted screen. No airflow is coming through so there is some surface mold/mildew building up on the ceiling
Solution: Replace screen above the shower

Problem: Back stairs and railings are loose
Solution: Replace stair stringers, treads and railings

Problem: Shower heads and bath tubs are not reliable and sometimes clog up with sediment even though she is on a well
Solution: install a string filter on the main water line into the house and blow out lines/fixtures

Problem: Gutters are clogged and full of leaves right above her front porch. There also appears to be a low spot here and water pours down over the door during heavy rain events
Solution: clean out gutters and re-pitch

Problem: Shingles blowing off roof and seals blown on roof penetrations. Roof is not currently leaking and appears that it could start leaking at any point.
Solution: Begin formulating a plan on a roof replacment

Problem: Back stairs need a handrail
Solution: add a handrail to the back stairs

Problem: Linoleum in the home is deteriorating and needs to be replaced
Solution: Melinda said she has purchased a replacement linoleum and cannot find someone to put it down

Problem: Rotten siding - Melinda started replacing some of it and painting. The portion she and her family worked on looks excellent
Solution: Replace rotten siding with t1-11 or LP smart siding, paint, caulk, seal etc

Problem: Original roof has been kool sealed multiple times and has reached the end of it's life. A portion of the roof has a tarp over it and old tires. The original mobile home needs a new metal roof along with the porches / build ons
Solution: Trailer is 72 feet long and approximately 14' wide, The back build on is 6' deep and 64' long and front build on is 8' deep and 50' long. Approximately 1800 sqft of roof surface.

Problem: Carl and Wanda would benefit from some bathroom modifications such as higher toilets and more grab bars
Solution: Install higher toilets and more grab bars

Problem: Underpinning is OSB and in contact with the ground so it is rotting/falling apart. There is wire and stucco in certain areas, but it's not completed. Need to keep an eye on the rest of the underpinning. Replace the rotten portions to help keep animals out from under the home
Solution: Replace missing areas of underpinning and any rotten portions under the home to keep animals from gaining access

Problem: Duct work underneath house has been chewed up by animals. This duct work only supplies their AC run fortunately and not their heat.
Solution: Installed insulated flex ducts where needed

Problem: Carl and Wanda are having some mobility issues and getting into their home has become challenging. They have a large uneven rock walkway that has become nearly impassable for them. They need a ramp to help them get from the driveway into the house.
Solution: Build a 4' wide and at least 20' long ramp with a handrail to help them enter their home

Problem: Home needs the exterior pressure washed along with the decks/porches.
Solution: Pressure wash the exterior of the home, trim back bushes, stain porches/decks

Problem: Bath tub faucet sprays water when the shower is in use
Solution: Washers/seals are the most probably culprit. First try tightening up the connections to see if that solves the issue. The access panel to the back of the shower is in the kitchen

Problem: Back door is warped and does not seal right - leaks cold air during winter. Shirley said that the door has been kicked in several times through attempted break-ins
Solution: Replace the door with another mobile home door that has a window. She has asked that the new door have a cat door installed.

Problem: Reginia and Sherry would like all of the windows replaced since they do not seal properly. Sherry tapes up all of the windows before winter arrives every year. They told me this was a very low priority and a "wishlist" item. There are 12 windows in total
Solution: Replace the windows with more energy efficient windows

Problem: Gutter has pulled loose from the back of the house
Solution: Reattach gutter to facia on the back of the house

Problem: Chimney stucco is falling off
Solution: Restucco the chimney

Problem: T1-11 siding, soffits and window trim need fresh paint
Solution: Paint the exterior of the house. Consult with Regina and Sherry regarding color choices first

Problem: Basement sliding glass door does not lock properly and seals are blown
Solution: Replace sliding glass door in the basement

Problem: Sliding glass door on the back of the house no longer functioning properly
Solution: While building the new back deck install a new sliding glass door

Problem: Only one exit out of the front door. Regina needs a second exit out of the back of the house. The previous deck rotted and had to be taken down
Solution: Build an 8 x 8 or 10 x 10 deck with stairs down to the ground. Regina has asked for the stairs to be broken up with a 4' x 4' landing in the middle

Problem: Front Porch - needs railings, new deck boards and new set of stairs (potentially a ramp)
Solution: Repair the front deck (if possible) and install railings along with new stairs. Regina must have a sturdy hand rail to go up and down stairs

Problem: Laminate flooring in kitchen needs to be completed. Velma said a group of volunteers started the project and never finished under her appliances.
Solution: Velma has a box of flooring to go under neath of the new appliances.

Problem: Loose outlet in the kitchen
Solution: reconnect the outlet

Problem: Vinyl underpinning has come loose in several areas and some of it has been broken
Solution: Try to reconnect the vinyl underpinning to the house before replacing everything. If necessary contact Discount Mobile Home Supply in Woodfin and order some new underpinning to replace the damaged sections.

Problem: Laminate flooring in kitchen needs to be completed
Solution: Velma has some boxes of flooring to finish the job

Problem: Roof is leaking around plumbing boots and vents. Roof looks to be in really good shape and Velma did not really know the age of it. She thought it was original to the mobile home, but the shingles still have most of their grit.
Solution: Replace worn out plumbing boots and vents. Reseal all boots/vents with proper roofing cement

Problem: Randall is no longer able to manage the vegetation behind her house.
Solution: Cut back brush under Randall's supervision using a weed eater and hand tools

Problem: Flashing around back chimney is leaking
Solution:
Repair flashing around back chimney

Seal around pipe bout vent and two chimneys

Problem: Mini-split is broken and needs to be replaced
Solution: Replace or repair minisplit system

Problem: Suspect major mold problem - low crawlspace under bedrooms and bathroom. Strong moldy/musty smell emanating from all rooms (my eyes were burning). Carpet in bedrooms is most likely harboring mold growth in all of the bedrooms. Floor has rotten in the middle bedroom due to moisture issues. I suspect mold growth is so substantial that it is negatively affecting Randall's health she was very stuffy when I was there. She mentioned that she may have a place she could stay for several days while this repair is happening.
Solution: Very extensive repair to make this right - tear out all carpet in all of the bedrooms and replace all moldy/rotten floor boards, joists, sills, studs, etc. This is going to happen again unless excess moisture behind house and poor ventilation under the house is dealt with as part of the fix. Install french drain behind house and backfill with gravel, install 6mil plastic vapor barrier under low crawlspace portion of the home to prevent future moisture intrusion issues. Install new floor sheating (prefer 3/4" Advantec glued and screwed), replace carpet with a hardwood floor, laminate or engineered floor. Paint room and repair drywall/plaster. A repair this large you will not really know what you're getting into until the floor is opened up very tough to determine overall cost/scope upfront.

Problem: water heater not working
Solution: investigate if it can repaired or needs replacement

Problem: Drywall is master bedroom closet ceiling has fallen down from a past leak. Dale does not like putting her clothes in the closet because the insulation gets all over them.
Solution: Repair drywall ceiling in master bedroom closet

Problem: Furnace is not reliable and needs to be serviced/repaired. Dale has gas logs in the living room that she uses as a back up heater when the furnace is not working.
Solution: Hire an HVAC tech to assess the furnace issues

Problem: Dale has breathing issues and is on oxygen. The carpet is badly worn out in her home and it causes her to have asthma fits.
Solution:
Dale said that she only needs the carpet replaced in her bedroom, living room and dining room. Pull out carpet and replace with a lighter colored floor (laminate or engineered if possible). Dale asked for a light color since her home is so dark.

Bedroom is approximately 13 x 16

Living Room is approximately 26 x 16

Dining Room is approximate 13 x 13

Total Sqft - 793

Problem: Electrical issues in half of the home. No lights in Dale's closest, laundry room, kitchen, etc. She is concerned that the issue may cause a fire. It's possible that this issue was caused from a dishwasher leak in the kitchen.
Solution: Hire an electrician to troubleshoot and repair the electrical issues

Problem: Window leaking on the north side of the house
Solution: Replace old window with new window. Replace rotten wood around frame - caulk/seal all gaps

Problem: Side porch should be stained to help prolong life - it's 16 +/- yrs old
Solution: Pressure wash then stain/seal side porch

Problem: Main entry - side porch. Stairs and railings need to be replaced. Railings around porch will need to be replaced as well they're rotten. There are some missing joist hangers that need to be replaced and deck needs to be ledger locked to the house since it's not bolted.
Solution: Replace side porch stairs and railings, ledger lock porch to the house and replace missing joist hangers. Side porch is 83.25" wide x 60" deep - stairs are 67" long and 45" wide x 34" high

Problem: Seal/stain front porch and stairs to prolong life
Solution: Pressure wash then seal/stain front porch and stairs

Problem: Front porch stairs are extremely unsafe - slick and rotted
Solution:
Tear off stairs and replace them with a new set of stringers and railings

Porch is 86.75" high and stairs are 11' long x 48" wide

Problem: Rotten facia and soffits
Solution: Repair/replace all rotten facia and soffits prior to having new gutters put on the house

Problem: Wood stove is their only source of heat and they do not have a backup. One of Tim's previous tenants (Yahe Boda) was caught with a very large marijuana grow operation several years ago and law enforcement tore out much of the duct work and the furnace no longer worked after this.
Solution: Get a quote to repair the furnace and run new duct work or look at other options to give them a back up source of heat in the winter.

Problem: Major water intrusion problem into the basement and it needs further troubleshooting (1) Worst case scenario - foundation/footer drain has failed and needs to be dug out and basement wall resealed with a rubber membrane and backfilled with gravel (extremely expensive) (2) Gutters are undersized for the house and should be replaced with 6 inch gutters (roof area is approximately 1700 sqft +/-). The gutters on the house at the porch do not have end caps.
Solution:
When the roof is replaced - replace the gutters and downspouts with 6 inch gutters to carry away more water. The gutters may be getting overwhelmed because of the roof surface area. If this does not correct the problem then further investigation will be necessary to determine how the water is gaining entry into the basement. The rock veneer is cracking and separating from block wall and that could be providing an entry point, but the overhangs on the roof should be preventing the large amount of water that Tim describes in basement.

Estimated repair cost is only for the gutters and downspouts

Problem: Drywall damages in upstairs bathroom
Solution: Patch drywall and repaint

Problem: Bath tub tile is cracked beside tub and is leaking water into the basement
Solution: Tear up tile and replace rotten subfloor and re-tile. It will be tough to find a tile that matches the existing tile. Make sure to caulk along the edge of the tub

Problem: Living room fan no longer working - need an electrician to trouble shoot
Solution: Hire an electrician to trouble shoot issue with fan

Problem: fluorescent kitchen light ballast is going bad and is no longer reliable
Solution: replace fluorescent light fixture ballast

Problem: Roof is original to when the house was built and has begun leaking. The shingles are blowing off and leaks are occurring around the rock chimney, wood stove pipe and several other places. Shingles appear to have very minimal grit. There are multiple vents/penetrations on the roof.
Solution: Go over shingles with new metal roof, replace all plumbing boots and vents, flash around chimney, flash around wood stove etc. This is a very large roofing job (approx 1700 - 1800 sqft of roof best estimate)

Problem: Due to recent heavy rainfall events, Sharon's culvert crossing is starting to completely fail. Her neighbors dumped some gravel on top of the culverts to help stabilize the crossing and so she can walk across. She has not been able to her house since this happened and has been using a wheelbarrow to take things to and from her pickup truck. The crossing is approximately 23' long and 20' wide.
Solution: This job is going to require heavy equipment since the crossing has not been totally washed out and is in the process of failing. The two 48" culverts need to be replaced with larger pipes to handle more flow. The culverts will need several loads of earth and gravel placed over top to stabilize.

Problem: No backup heat in the home. Calvin and Jeff are using a propane space heater in their house and it gets really cold in the winter time. They would really like to have a woodstove installed in their home and I told them I was unsure if CHC could do that due to liability. They do have a monitor heater that they have not been able to get serviced that worked great years ago.
Solution: Look into getting Calvin and Jeff's monitor heater working again or look at other heating options for them this upcoming winter

Problem: Insulation is missing inside of the home and no insulation underneath of the home
Solution: Purchase fiberglass batts and install insulation throughout the home and underneath to get it ready for the winters of 2020 - 2022.

Problem: Roof is leaking in several places
Solution: Calvin and Jeff suggested Kool Sealing the entire roof instead of putting on a new metal roof. Purchase 10 - 12 gallons of Kool Seal, brushes, rollers, etc. They are holding out for a new home and do not think it's necessary to invest a tremendous amount of money into this home.

Problem: Front deck and stairs are unsafe - detached from home.
Solution: tear off and replace the front deck and stairs

Problem: Peggy is a quadriplegic and does not have a good access point to get into her house with her electric wheelchair. Her chair is extremely heavy and gets stuck in the mud around their house. She needs a ramp or an elevator installed along with a walkway to allow her to reach the driveway for transportation.
Solution: Add a ramp to the back of the home, replace back deck and build a 48" wide walkway to allow Peggy to reach the driveway for transportation. There is a large outbuilding that was added on as living space and it will make building a ramp/walkway very challenging. A portion of the bank will need to be removed and braced to keep from failing. Cost for this repair is just a guess since there are many different factors that could make this much more expensive. The walkway will likely need to be elevated due to the amount of rock that is present.

Problem: Uneven and rotting floor underneath french door
Solution: repair rotten floor and level floor so it's even with the deck outside - right now there is a slight curb/edge that Peggy's electric wheelchair get's stuck on.

Problem: French door leaks onto floor inside home also floor is uneven see additional repair for interior floor
Solution: Replace leaking french door with a more weather tight door. (French door is used to get Peggy in and out of the house so it's necessery that the door opening be 36" or wider)

Problem: No water
Solution: Caldwell Drilling states they need new pump, wiring, and pressure tank

Problem: 8 - Old single pane windows need to be replaced
Solution: Replace old windows with a higher efficiency vinyl replacement

Problem: Termite damage evident throughout the house
Solution: Consult with a pest control expert

Problem: Living room ceiling fan - blades fell off
Solution: Tim has a new ceiling fan replacement sitting in a box in the living and is not able to complete the repair on his own

Problem: Facia and soffit are rotting in several areas
Solution: replace soffit and facia with pressure treated 1x material.

Problem: Hot water heater not working correctly and is unreliable. Tim has replaced most of the elements and still not working properly
Solution: Install a new electric hot water heater

Problem: House is having electrical issues - breakers tripped, outlets don't work etc..
Solution: Have a licensed electrician assess and offer guidance on the best way to proceed after the roof is repaired

Problem: Bathroom floor and tub surround is in bad shape. A full bathroom remodel would be highly beneficial to the client since they only have one bathroom and the floor is rotting. Bathroom is 86" x 80"
Solution: Remodel the bathroom

Problem: Ceiling in the addition is falling down due to the roof leak
Solution: tear out rotten drywall/insulation, replace and repaint after roof is repaired

Problem: Tim Sr is concerned with his mobility and would like a ramp installed to the front porch. The front porch appears to be in good condition
Solution: Build a 4' wide handicap ramp

Problem: Kitchen floor is buckling and feels unsafe
Solution: jack up floor under the kitchen in the crawlspace and install pressure treated beams perpendicular to the floor joists. Be careful when jacking up the floor some of the beams may be cracked or compromised due to termite damage.

Problem: Roof leaking badly and seam on addition - very low pitched roof
Solution: tear off roof on addition and replace with a membrane roof. Also, Tin on existing roof is over 30 years old it does not appear to be leaking at the time of the assessment. If money and budget allows it may be best to replace the whole roof. Save the metal for skirting mobile homes.

Problem: Electric furnace is not working because the client could not find a filter that fit the unit
Solution: Client seems happy with the monitor heater and using kerosene space heaters due to lower cost.

Problem: Holes in walls - Mary's sons punched holes in the walls all throughout the mobile home
Solution: repair/patch holes in the walls throughout the home and repaint

Problem: Hallway bathroom - needs to be remodeled - 54" x 88" - Tub is cracked and leaks they're currently using a piece of tape to prevent the tub from leaking. Carpet is in really bad shape and needs to be pulled.
Solution: Remodel bathroom and make it handicap accessible - maybe a good referral for independent living after we repair the entrances/exits to the home

Problem: Skylight over garden tub - potential leak problem in the future - client does not like it
Solution: Roof over the skylight when it's time to put on a new roof

Problem: Shower in bedroom leaks around knobs
Solution: First attempt to reseal or tighten connections prior to replacing. If resealing or tightening does not work then replace the knob set

Problem: Air conditioner leaked in the master bedroom and has made the floor soft. The electrical outlet sparks and is not reliable/potentially a fire hazard
Solution: Tear out the soft sections of floor and sister in new joists to support the floor (it may just be that the subfloor is rotten and joists are fine). Replace subfloor with plywood that matches original floor height.

Problem: Kitchen sink leaks and they're using a bucket to catch water
Solution: First try to tighten the plumbing and add some plumbers putty to the basket to see if that helps. If not, replace the pipe down to the trap

Problem: Front Door leaking and rotting floor
Solution: Tear out rotten subfloor/flooring and sister in new joists. Replace subfloor with a material that matches the original height and put down new flooring. Determine where the door is leaking and reseal

Problem: Exterior grime/dirt
Solution: Pressure wash the home after windows are replaced

Problem: Stabilize back porch and repair/replace stairs to make a safe entry/exit point
Solution: Replace any rotten wood, add joist hangers if needed, brace up deck etc...Replace/repair stairs

Problem: Front porch totally unsafe and needs to be torn off/replaced
Solution:
Repair the back porch stairs and back door first before tearing off the front stairs since this is their main entry point. Also, the trash will need to be hauled off before this work can be completed.

Replace front porch with an 8'x8' pressure treated porch and handicap 4' wide handicap accessible ramp. Mary has already verbally OK'ed giving up some of her parking to accommodate a ramp.

Problem: Windows smashed out by autistic son
Solution:
Call Discount Mobile home for replacement windows

Three front windows - 54" x 31" inside (broken glass difficult to measure) $525 online

Three side windows - 66" x 30" inside (broken glass difficult to measure) $600 online

Problem: Tremendous amount of trash needs hauling off
Solution: ***A neighbor already complained about the amount of trash to the Health Department - this needs to be done prior to working on the exterior of the home*** Rent dumpsters and load trash into them *Make sure heavy duty leather gloves are worn at all times for safety*. It will take several dumpster loads to complete this job. Please be aware that Mary likes to strip copper wire from electronics to make extra income. Griffin waste services offers a 10 yard roll-off dumpster (828) 484-0256. Rachael at Griffin Waste estimates around $1,400 and 4 dumpster loads (it may take more) - just depends on weight. TV's, Appliances, etc. need to be stacked on top ($10 extra) or near the dump gate. Can stack trash 1' over the edge of the dumpster if it's regular household waste.

Problem: Home needs skirting
Solution: Re-purpose metal roofing if possible instead of purchasing vinyl skirting. Home is 76' long to tongue and 14' wide. Home height from ground varies from end to end.

Problem: Monitor heater - does not work. Uses firewood as a primary heat source and his mobility issues are making it harder to split/collect/stack firewood
Solution: repair monitor heater as a secondary heat source

Problem: fiberglass insulation under newer addition is falling down
Solution: install new fiberglass batts with strapping to hold them in place

Problem: Flashing around chimney is coming loose and needs to be re-caulked/sealed
Solution: reseal flashing around chimney

Problem: No vapor barrier under the log cabin portion of the home
Solution: Install vapor barrier under the log cabin portion of the home

Problem: The homeowner does not like the fluorescent lighting throughout the home and it makes loud humming noises in the summer time due to the increased humidity.
Solution: Replace fluorescent lights with higher efficiency LED lighting

Problem: Roof leak - Flat porch roof is causing water to back up and flow through the laundry room ceiling
Solution: Remove shingles from porch roof and flat portion of laundry room roof. Replace rotten plywood/roof decking as needed and use a membrane roof instead of shingles or metal. Inside the laundry room, replace wet insulation and wet drywall. The roof appears to have been leaking for awhile and the true extent of the interior damage to the laundry room is unknown.

Problem: Vapor barrier - has been blown around by wind and no longer in proper position
Solution: Install new vapor barrier under the home

Problem: Crawlspace - belly liner is torn in two places exposing the floor joists and insulation is missing between those joists.
Solution: Repair belly liner and install new fiberglass batts

Problem: Guest Bathroom Sink - sink leaks when under pressure
Solution: Was not able to determine if the faucet was cracked or if there was a loose water supply connection because of the small space. Talking with Hazel she is convinced that the faucet is cracked due to previous repair person wrenching on the sink/overtightening. Recommend replacing the faucet and using longer supply lines.

Problem: Guest Bathroom Toilet - Runs constantly
Solution: Install a new chain that is shorter and does not get wrapped up in the flapper.

Problem: kitchen pipe came loose
Solution: hire Autry for repair

Problem:
Side stairs need replacing with something more permanent - metal temporary looking stairs

Back stairs feel wobbly and not very safe
Solution: Replace both side and back stairs

Problem: Outlet not working in small bathroom
Solution: See if a volunteer electrician can troubleshoot this issue

Problem: Front door weatherstripping - door needs to be re-weatherstripped and caulked. Cold air pours through the door and makes the living room cold. The jamb may need to be rebuilt since it's somewhat busted.
Solution: weather strip the front door and repair jamb if necessary

Problem: Back bathroom water is trickling - can't take a shower and soft floor around the toilet
Solution: Hire a plumber to troubleshoot why the shower is not getting water (sediment in line from previous spring use?). Also while the plumber is there he could install Billy & Mary's hot water heater

Problem: Vernon and Orlie need help hauling off their trash
Solution: See if a volunteer will help Vernon and Orlie take their trash away - contact for dump card

Problem:
Kitchen window leak - bad/crumbling rubber flashing around a flue pipe above the kitchen window is what is believed to be causing the window to leak in a heavy rain event. The window is protected by a large eave even though it's not flashed or caulked properly on the outside.

Roof leak above kitchen door - there is a vent fan on the roof that has bad/crumbling rubber flashing and it appears that water is running down to the area above the kitchen door.

The roof in general looks visibly OK and no other solution for the leaks could be found other than those mentioned above
Solution: re-flash the vent/flue pipes with roofing tar

Problem: Portion of gutter on the left side of the house has fallen off. Facia/soffit has rotten and fallen off as well
Solution:
Hire a gutter specialist to replace the missing portion of gutter

Repair rotten facia and soffit

Problem: Floor has some slope and give to it in the hallway and kitchen.
Solution: Need to examine further and gain access to the basement area first.

Problem: Hallway floor is higher than the other flooring in the home and creates thresholds that could present a trip/fall hazard
Solution: Add in gently sloping thresholds that do not present as much of a trip/fall hazard

Problem: No vapor barrier in the crawlspace or insulation in the floor joists
Solution: Add a 6 mil+ vapor barrier on the ground in the crawlspace and add in insulation in between the floor joists

Problem: Old single pane windows - some of them do not have latches and Flora has a hard time pushing them closed
Solution: Replace windows with more energy efficient windows

Problem: Flora did not ask for a bathroom remodel, but she could really benefit from one. Her toilet is extremely low and the floor is very soft around the toilet. She only has one bathroom so arrangements would need to be made for her to stay with family or friends until the bathroom is replaced.
Solution:
Tear out bathroom and replace.

Vent fan, subfloor, vinyl plank and trim, commode,walk in shower, moen bath shower fixture.

Problem: Basement stairs are very narrow and dangerous - fall hazard. Flora's laundry is in her basement and she goes down the stairs a few times a week. She asked that I not go down there. She also did not seem open to moving the laundry upstairs because she doesn't think there is enough room in her house for it.
Solution:
Present some options for moving her laundry upstairs so she no longer has to go into the basement. The basement stairs may be able to be made safer with a better railing system.

Laundry was moved to second bedroom.

Problem: Deck - shaky and rotten in some places. Both sets of stairs do not appear safe. Flora said that she does not go out onto the deck any more for fear of her safety. Flora really needs a safe/reliable second access out of her home in case of emergency
Solution:
1) Could work on shoring up the deck adding additional posts and joist hangers. Replace unsafe stairs

2) Tear off deck and replace with something sturdier that will last

Problem: Front Stairs - dangerous (slick) and no railings. This is Flora's only way in and out of the house
Solution: Replace front stairs with a ramp or wide tread/low rise stairs and add railings

Problem: Windows - old 1960 single pane windows. Len would like them replaced
Solution: Replace windows with newer more efficient double pane windows

Problem: Hardwood floors need to be refinished - coming apart in some areas
Solution: Sand and refinish the hardwood flooors

Problem: Water intrusion in basement - water was pouring through multiple openings in the block wall during my visit. Len had attempted to plug the holes in the past and more keep popping up. Basement is considered a bathtub basement since there is no egress other than through the kitchen.
Solution: Trees/vegetation needs to be cleared around the home. A trench needs to be dug down to the footer and a french drain added along with water proofing the block wall and patching holes with hydraulic cement. Back fill with clean gravel.

Problem: Bathroom Safety Issues - Mr. Frisbee would greatly benefit from the addition of grab bars in his bathroom and a bathroom upgrade
Solution: Upgrade bathroom to better accommodate Mr. Frisbee

Problem: Old termite issues - some of the joists have been repaired and termites have been treated
Solution: continue to monitor for termite issues

Problem: Old electrical system from 1960's - no upgrades since then.
Solution: Home could really use a panel/electrical upgrade (glass and paper fuses)

Problem:
Roof - leaking roof and causing moisture/mold problem in the ceiling of the home

Gutters and downspouts - broken downspouts are helping create a water intrusion issue in the basement (home is also below the road where a tremendous amount of water comes from)
Solution: Roof, gutters and downspouts really needs to be replaced. Len would like a metal roof for his Dad and has a local crew that he would like to bid on the project

Problem: No permanent heat source
Solution: Install 3 zone mini-split.

Problem: Roof - roof leaks in several areas: corner by stair landing, backup stove pipe, skylight. Ember would like a gutter installed over her steps.
Solution: Roof has been patched several times and has a very steep pitch. It may be time to have a professional evaluate her roof and possibly look at a total replacement or repairing properly in the deficient areas.

Problem: Siding - lots of gaps in the barnwood siding that allows airflow. Some rotten areas close to the ground level.
Solution: Repair/replace siding as needed with natural materials

Problem: Oval door knobs - Ember struggles with arthritis and has found that oval door knobs work best for her/don't hurt her hands to operate
Solution: Be on the lookout for more oval doorknobs at ReClaim or other salvage areas

Problem: Childproof Gate - Needs a childproof gate constructed to keep Ashley out of the toxic storage area.
Solution: Hire a handyman/carpenter to construct a gate necessary to protect/prevent Ashley from getting into the toxic storage area

Problem: Plumbing - Sink drain line leaks under the house and needs to be glued together (confirm PVC glue is ok to use with Ember). Spring reservoir/cistern needs to be swished out and plumbing lines need to be blown out. Lots of sediment in the washing machine when it's first used. Low gravity fed spring does not provide much water pressure to the house and they are not able to use the shower. There is only hotwater being supplied to the bathtub and not to the kitchen sink.
Solution: Hire a plumber to help troubleshoot some of these issues. I do not think Ember wants a booster pump put on her house and we cannot move the location of the spring or the house to provide more pressure.

Problem: Crawlspace - Ember thinks that Mountain Housing Opportunities put the skirting around the outside of her house. The skirting has been damaged and needs to be repaired. Ember wants the plastic vapor barrier under the house removed and the insulation redone. MHO did not use any strapping to hold the insulation and even told her they knew they were doing a bad job.
Solution: See if a group of volunteers could assist and do a better job

Problem: Windows - need reglazing/painting *Suspect Lead Paint*
Solution: *Suspect presence of Lead Paint* Hire someone to properly reglaze the windows that is familiar/trained in dealing with lead paint

Problem: Excess Trash - Ember has quite a few loads of trash that needs to be taken to the landfill. She does not have a pickup truck to haul it away.
Solution: See if a volunteer would be willing to assist Ember in hauling away what she needs gone

Problem: Front Stairs - railings are rotting and stairs are very slick when it rains. Ember does not like pressure treated wood so locust should be used if possible
Solution: Repair front stairs with anti-slip grip tape on the treads to keep people from slipping off the stairs. Repair the risers and railings with locust that may be able to be sourced from the property
